flagitatio: <entryFree id="n18278" type="main" key="fla_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flagito</etym>, <sense id="n18278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earnest request</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importunity</hi> (rare but class.): nolui deesse ne tacitae quidem flagitationi tuae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorum flagitatione revocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae populi flagitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagitator: <entryFree id="n18279" type="main" key="fla_gi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an importunate asker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dun</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eicite ex animo curam atque alienum aes: Ne quis formidet flagitatorem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 81</bibl>; so of a <hi rend="ital">dunning creditor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc video flagitatorem, non illum quidem tibi molestum, sed assiduum tamen et acrem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit> (see the passage in connection).—</sense><sense id="n18279.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi ante victoriam flagitator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagitatrix: <entryFree id="n18280" type="main" key="fla_gi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flagitator</etym>, <sense id="n18280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that importunately demands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duns</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistola vehemens flagitatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 140" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagitiose: <entryFree id="n18281" type="main" key="fla_gi^ti^o_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtĭōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. flagitiosus <sense id="n18281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
flagitiosus: <entryFree id="n18282" type="main" key="fla_gi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flagitium</etym>, <sense id="n18282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flagitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profligate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi> (both of persons and things): <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiosi sunt, qui venereas voluptates inflammato animo concupiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo flagitiosissimus, libidinosissimus nequissimusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas pessima ac flagitiosissima facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosa et flagitiosa vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque videas rebus injustis justos maxime dolere, imbellibus fortes, flagitiosis modestos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lacl. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus omni genere voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptio, possessio bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiosissima facinora facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordia flagitiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama flagitiosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ea, quae re turpia non sunt, verbis flagitiosa ducamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem armis quam munificentia vinci, minus flagitiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiosissimum existimo impune injuriam accepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod flagitiosius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtĭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flagitiously</hi> (freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): impure et flagitiose vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpiter et flagitiose dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FLAG" /> 53, 227; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia male et flagitiose tueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumus flagitiose imparati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desciscere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitae legationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 141</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut turpissime flagitiosissimeque discedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire aliorum amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagitium: <entryFree id="n18283" type="main" key="fla_gi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>flagito; cf. Doed. Syn. 2, p. 143; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 398 sq.; orig., burning desire, heat of passion</etym>. <sense id="n18283.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an eager</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furious demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urgency</hi> (post-Aug. and rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flagitatio): Lentulus credebatur illa militiae flagitia primus aspernari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Plancina cum pudore et flagitio disseruit, matris preces obtendens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18283.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18283.2" n="A" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a shameful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful act done in the heat of passion; a burning shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful thing</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: scelus, nefas, facinus, maleficium, peccatum, delictum, crimen): quae (convivia) domesticis stupris flagitiisque flagrabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantissima (with adulteria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra et adulteria et omne tale flagitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticis vitiis atque flagitiis se inquinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sceleribus flagitiisque contaminatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sceleris et tantum flagitii admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae libido ab oculis, quod facinus a manibus umquam tuis, quod flagitium a toto corpore abfuit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Curius, flagitiis atque facinoribus coopertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil facinoris, nihil flagitii praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta flagitia facere et dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc flagitio versari ipsum videmus Jovem (corresp. to stuprum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tot flagitia se ingurgitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18283.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any shameful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (without the accessory idea of passion): <cit><quote lang="la">petere honorem pro flagitio more fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium fiet, nisi dos dabitur virgini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum loquimur terni, nihil flagitii dicimus: at cum bini, obscoenum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium rei militaris admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 128</bibl></cit>: flagiti principium est, nudare inter cives corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 70</bibl> (Trag. v. 426 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nonne id flagitium est, te aliis consilium dare, foris sapere, tibi non posse auxiliarier?</quote> <trans><tr>is it not a shame?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeesse agro colendo flagitium putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum flagitii commisisset (for which, shortly before: nihil turpius, quam, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 219</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita necesse fuit aut haec flagitia concipere animo aut susceptae philosophiae nomen amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>disgraceful assertions</tr>, <tr>absurdities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Fores hae fecerunt magnum flagitium modo. <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Quid id est flagitii? Crepuerunt clare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 32</bibl>.— Leg. t. t.: perfectum flagitium, <hi rend="ital">a completed crime</hi> (opp. imperfectum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18283.4" n="C" level="2"> In vulg. lang., concr. like scelus, <hi rend="ital">shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, as a term of reproach, i. q. <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium illud hominis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa quae sis stabulum flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: etiam opprobras vim, flagiti flagrantia, <hi rend="ital">burning shame</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">outrageous villain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium flagitiorum atque facinorum circum se tamquam stipatorum catervas habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18283.5" n="D" level="2"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">Shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id erat meum factum flagiti plenum et dedecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum dedecus et flagitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>: qui non gloria movemini neque flagitio, Sall. Or. Licin. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (p. 236 ed. Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">beatus qui pejus leto flagitium timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitio additis damnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia illa forma matrem familias flagitium sit si sequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere damni mavolo, Quam obprobramentum aut flagitium muliebre inferri domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium imperio demere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul moveri flagitio timoris fatendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 60, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagito: <entryFree id="n18284" type="main" key="fla_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> flagitarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 48</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> [from the root bherag-; Sanscr. <cb n="FLAG" /> bhraj-, to roast; Zend. berja, earnest longing; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fru/gw</foreign>; Lat. frīgĕre, frictum, Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 141 sq.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fle/gw</foreign>; Lat. flagrare, etc., Corss. Ausspr. 1, 398; Doed. Syn. 2, p. 143), <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi> a thing; or, with a personal object, <hi rend="ital">to press earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dun</hi> a person for any thing (qs. flagranter posco, exigo, rogo; cf. also: postulo, peto, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18284.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.); constr., <hi rend="ital">aliquid aliquem; aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquem;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with an <hi rend="ital">objectclause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18284.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam atque etiam insto atque urgeo, insector, posco, atque adeo flagito crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insector, inquam et flagito testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">qui reliquos non desideraret solum, sed etiam posceret et flagitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut admoneam te, non ut flagitem: metuo ne te forte flagitent: ego autem mandavi, ut rogarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitum venimus te, non flagitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis auxilium implorare et flagitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae tempus et necessitas flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia illum clamore vidi flagitarier,</quote> <trans><tr>called for by the public crier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but, si non dabis, clamore magno et multo flagitabere,</quote> <trans><tr>you shall be importuned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ejus sceleris in te ipsum quaestio flagitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: cum stipendium ab legionibus paene seditione factā flagitaretur, <hi rend="ital">when the legions demanded their pay</hi> (the <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> different from the foll.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus desiderio Romuli regem flagitare non destitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te cum tua promissa per litteras flagitabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem gloriae flagitat ab iis, quorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid gravitas, quid altitudo animi... quid artes a te flagitent, tu videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ex omnibus partibus ab eo flagitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:71:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 71, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicum miser abs te filium flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siser et ipsum Tiberius princeps nobilitavit flagitans omnibus annis a Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt illa, quae me ludens Crassus modo flagitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidie Caesar Aeduos frumentum flagitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potentem amicum Largiora flagito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18284.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper flagitavi, ut convocaremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitare senatus institit Cornutum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitabatur ab his quotidie ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18284.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed flagitat tabellarius: valebis igitur, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>presses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa postulat, non flagitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18284.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(stomachus) pernā magis ac magis hillis Flagitat immorsus refici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a delatoribus revocanda praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:65" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 65</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint ea numina flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 123</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18284.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18284.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To summon before court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compertum pecuniam publicam avertisse ut peculatorem flagitari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18284.8" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to incite to lewdness</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ancillam alienam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215</bibl></cit>: intercutibus stupris flagitatus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 719</bibl> P.; cf.: inter cutem flagitatos dicebant antiqui mares, qui stuprum passi essent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110:23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110, 23</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
flagrans: <entryFree id="n18285" type="main" key="fla_^grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from flagro.</entryFree>
flagranter: <entryFree id="n18286" type="main" key="fla_^granter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^granter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. flagro, <sense id="n18286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
flagrantia: <entryFree id="n18287" type="main" key="fla_^granti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flagro</etym>, <sense id="n18287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a glowing heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi> (mostly post-class.). </sense><sense id="n18287.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis (Aetnae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 178: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiva,</quote> <trans><tr>the heat of summer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, p. 183</bibl></cit>: non flagrantiā oculorum, non libertate sermonis, sed etiam complexu; etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18287.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: omnem pectoris flagrantiam sedare, <hi rend="ital">vehement desire</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 734: <cit><quote lang="la">materna,</quote> <trans><tr>maternal affection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—Concr. as a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam opprobras vim, flagiti flagrantia?</quote> <trans><tr>thou burning shame! worst of scoundrels!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. flagitium, II. A. <pb n="756" /> <cb n="FLAG" /></sense></entryFree>
flagratores: <entryFree id="n18288" type="gloss" key="flagra_to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flagrātōres</orth> <itype>dicebantur genus hominum, quod mercede flagris caedebantur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89, 5</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <sense id="n18288.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">‡ flagratores qui flagris conducti caedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagrifer: <entryFree id="n18289" type="hapax" key="fla_^gri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flagrum + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing a whip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Automedon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 14, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagriones: <entryFree id="n18290" type="main" key="flagri^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flagrĭōnes</orth> <itype>dicti servi</itype>, quod flagris subjecti sunt: <sense id="n18290.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ut verberones a verberibus. Afranius in Vopisco: Tu flagrionibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 391 ed. Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
flagritriba: <entryFree id="n18291" type="main" key="fla_^gri_^tri^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grī^trĭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flagrum + tero</etym>, <sense id="n18291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whip-spoiler</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who wears out the whip with being flogged</hi>, a comic appellative of a slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flagro: <entryFree id="n18292" type="main" key="fla_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. brag-, to glow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fle/gw, flege/qw, flo/c</foreign>; Lat. fulgeo, fulgur, fulmen, flamma, flamen, fulvus; Angl.-Sax. blāc, pale; Germ. bleich; connected with flagito, flagitium, etc., by Corss. Ausspr. 1, 398</etym>, <sense id="n18292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi> (class.; trop. signif. most freq.; not in Caes.; syn.: ardeo, deflagro, caleo, ferveo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18292.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantes onerariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinemque flagrantem excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrabant ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:439" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intima pars hominum vero flagrabat ad ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flocci molles et sine oleo flagrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut flagret (carbo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18292.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, sc. according as the notion of heat or of the pain produced by burning predominates (cf. flamma, II.). </sense><sense id="n18292.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be inflamed with passion</hi> (in a good and a bad sense), <hi rend="ital">to blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be violently excited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stirred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoked.</hi>—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dici potest, quam flagrem desiderio urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eximio litterarum amore, Quint. prooem. § 6: mirabili pugnandi cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate atque amentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:81" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 81</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinibus in mulieres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Italiam flagraturam bello intelligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello flagrans Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia quae domesticis stupris flagitiisque flagrabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrabant vitia libidinis apud illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti cujusque studium ex aetate flagrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc. of respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestem flagrans amor Herculis Heben,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus et diris flagrat latratibus ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 220</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18292.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> as a <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to inflame with passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elisam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:120" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18292.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be greatly disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexed; to suffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules flagrant infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā et infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 49, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumore malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 125</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiā et pudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiā et cupidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. Philipp. p. 220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. Philipp. p. 220</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18292.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fulmen, Varr. Atacin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantis hora Caniculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantissimo aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18292.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aeneas) Sidereo flagrans clipeo et caelestibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redditur extemplo flagrantior aethere lampas (i. e. sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:731" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 731</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18292.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">glowing with passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoria studia quibus etiam te incendi, quamquam flagrantissimum acceperam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocris orator, sed et ingenio peracri et studio flagranti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentibus praeceptorum studiis flagrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrans, odiosa, loquacula, Lampadium fit,</quote> <trans><tr>flickering</tr>, <tr>restless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suis studiis flagrans cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantissima flagitia, adulteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantissimus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero flagrantior in dies amore Poppaeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonis flagrantissimae libidines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> 3: <cit><quote lang="la">studia plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger et flagrans animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantior aequo Non debet dolor esse viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 11</bibl></cit>: adhuc flagranti<cb n="FLAM" />  crimine comprehensi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the very act</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 13, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^gran-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ardently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Germani exarsere flagrantius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantius amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Anton. 2" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Anton. 2</bibl></cit> ed. Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantissime cupĕre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flagrum: <entryFree id="n18293" type="main" key="fla_^grum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flā^grum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf.: fligo, af-fligo, etc. and flagellum</etym>, <sense id="n18293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lash</hi> (syn.: verber, scutica, flagellum). </sense><sense id="n18293.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:9 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18293.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sua qui domitos deduxit flagra Quirites,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to servitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 109</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach applied to a slave: Gymnasium flagri, salve, <hi rend="ital">School for the scourge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on whom the scourge is often tried</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 31</bibl>: lassitudo conservum, rediviae flagri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whose skin is cut up by the lash</hi>, Titin. ap. Fest. s. v. redivia, p. 270, 20 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
flamen: <entryFree id="n18294" type="main" key="fla_men1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmen</orth> (also ‡ <sense id="n18294.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">FILAMEN,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 227, 6</bibl></cit>), <itype>mis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>same root with fla-gro, q. v.; lit., he who burns, sc. offerings, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 84, 146; cf. 2, 86 note; Momms. Röm. Gesch. 1, 155; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 301" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 301</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of one particular deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flamen</hi> (acc. to a false etym. of Varr. and Fest., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, so called from the fillet which he wore around his head). Festus enumerates from the highest flamen, that of Jupiter, to the lowest, that of Pomona, fifteen of these priests; <cit><quote lang="la">in the times of the emperors, the deified emperors and other deified persons also had their separate flamens assigned to them: flamines, quod in Latio capite velato erant semper, ac caput cinctum habebant filo, flamines dicti. Horum singuli cognomina habent ab eo deo, quoi sacra faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.: flamen Dialis dictus, quod filo assidue velatur, indeque appellatur flamen, quasi filamen, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 15</bibl> Müll.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae dignationis Flamen Dialis est inter quindecim flamines, et cum ceteri discrimina majestatis suae habeant, minimi habetur Pomonalis, quod Pomona levissimo fructui agrorum praesidit pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=154:27 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 154, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. Comm. ad h. l. p. 385, b: DIVIS ALIIS ALII SACERDOTES, OMNIBVS PONTIFICES, SINGVLIS FLAMINES SVNTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa) flaminem Jovi assiduum sacerdotem creavit ... huic duos flamines adjecit, Marti unum, alterum Quirino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 2, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: est ergo flamen, ut Jovi, ut Marti, ut Quirino, sic divo Julio M. Antonius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius flamines sibi decerni prohibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FLAMEN D. AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">488</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">AVGVSTALIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 643</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2366</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DIVI CLAVDII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2218</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PERPETVVS NERONIS AVG.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SALVTIS AVGVSTAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ROMAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaminem prodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaugurare flaminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18295" type="main" key="fla_men2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>flo</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">pneu=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n18295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blast</hi>, esp. of wind (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, most freq. in the <number>plur.</number>; cf.: ventus, flatus, flabra, spiritus, aura). </sense><sense id="n18295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Berecynthiae Cessant flamina tibiae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 16</bibl>: aquilo suo cum flamine, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 424 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Borea, surdas flamine tunde fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a gale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt sua flamina classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 832</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:599" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 599</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamina conticuere, jacet sine fluctibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:732" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 732</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18296" type="main" key="Fla_men3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Claudia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flamentum: <entryFree id="n18297" type="hapax" key="fla_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>flo</etym>, <sense id="n18297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi> of the wind: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
flamina: <entryFree id="n18298" type="gloss" key="fla_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. flamen</etym>, <sense id="n18298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of a flamen</hi>, usu. flaminica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 459, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flaminalis: <entryFree id="n18299" type="gloss" key="fla_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has been a flamen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3932</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">FLAMINALES VIRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaminatus: <entryFree id="n18300" type="gloss" key="fla_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of flamen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3978</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flaminia: <entryFree id="n18301" type="main" key="fla_mi^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. flaminius, II. A.</entryFree>
flaminianus: <entryFree id="n18302" type="main" key="Fla_mi^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Flaminius, II. C.</entryFree>
flaminica: <entryFree id="n18303" type="main" key="fla_mi^ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. flamen</etym>, <sense id="n18303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of a flamen</hi>, who assisted at the sacrifices: <cb n="FLAM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2225 sq.</bibl>: flaminicae Diales, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. ex Fest. s. v. flaminia, p. 93 Müll.: FLAMINICAE PRIMAE AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaminica omnibus nundinis in regia Jovi arietem soleat immolare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flamininus: <entryFree id="n18304" type="main" key="Fla_mi^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Quintia. So in partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Quintius Flamininus,</quote> <trans><tr>the conqueror of King Philip of Macedonia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flaminius: <entryFree id="n18305" type="main" key="fla_mi^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. flamen</etym>, <sense id="n18305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a flamen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18305.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: flaminia aedes domus flaminis Dialis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89, 10</bibl> Müll.; so, ex domo flaminia, id. s. v. ignem, p. 106, 4 Müll.; cf. in the foll.: flaminius camillus puer dicebatur ingenuus patrimes et matrimes, qui flamini Diali ad sacrificia praeministrabat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93, 2 sq.</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">flaminius lictor est, qui flamini Diali sacrorum causa praesto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18305.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18305.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">flāmĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18305.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">the dwelling of the</hi> flamen Dialis: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem e flaminia, id est flaminis Dialis domo, nisi sacrum efferri jus non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18305.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A young priestess who attended on the wife of the</hi> flamen Dialis: flaminia dicebatur sacerdotula, quae flaminicae Diali praeministrabat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93, 6</bibl> Müll. (but perh., from the preceding words of Festus, we are to supply the word camilla, and to read flaminia camilla, like flaminius camillus; cf. Müll. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n18305.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">flămĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of flamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl>; Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18306" type="main" key="Fla_mi^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So C. Flaminius Nepos, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when censor</hi>, A.U.C. 534, <hi rend="ital">built a circus and constructed a road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was overcome and slain by Hannibal at the lake of Trasimenus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18306.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18306.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Flaminius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Flaminian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea omnia in pratis Flaminiis acta, quem nunc Circum Flaminium appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 33 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:74:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 74, 2</bibl>; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 604; 608 and 667 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1, p. 361: via, leading from Rome to Ariminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18306.3" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, sc. via, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 2</bibl>; along it stood many tombs; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: quorum Flaminia tegitur cinis atque Latina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:171" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18306.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāmĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Flaminian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flamma: <entryFree id="n18307" type="main" key="flamma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flamma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> flammaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 725</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:900" default="NO" valid="yes">900</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1099" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1099</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for flagma, v. flagro; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fle/gma</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">fle/gw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a blazing fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame</hi> (cf. ignis). </sense><sense id="n18307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fana flammā deflagrata, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 116 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aiunt Ennium, flammam a sapiente facilius ore in ardente opprimi quam bona dicta teneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam concipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammā torreri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma ab utroque cornu comprehensa, naves sunt combustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 101, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumventi flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusa flamma pluribus locis reluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina illa non flammae, sed scintillis inter fumum emicantibus similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis flammam per caeli caerula pasci,</quote> <trans><tr>the blazing light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1090" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1090</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat is splendidissimo candore inter flammas circulus elucens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>among the blazing stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polo fixae flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum genitor rutilas per nubila flammas Spargit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flashing lightnings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam media ipsa tenebat Ingentem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a torch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 518</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">armant picis unguine flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:302" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 302</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for ignis: modum ponere iambis flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma ferroque absumi,</quote> <trans><tr>by fire and sword</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.2" n="b" level="4"> Provv. </sense><sense id="n18307.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Flamma fumo est proxima: <cit><quote lang="la">Fumo comburi nihil potest, flamma potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the slightest approach to impropriety leads to vice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18307.4" n="(b)" level="5"> E flamma cibum petere, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi> <pb n="757" /> <cb n="FLAM" /> <hi rend="ital">food from the flames</hi>, i. e. to be reduced to extremities for want of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 38</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n18307.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Prius undis flamma (sc. miscebitur), <hi rend="ital">sooner will fire mingle with water</hi>, of any thing impossible, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 21, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.6" n="(d)" level="5"> Unda dabit flammas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 4</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) flamma recens parva sparsa resedit aqua, = obsta principiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 190</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18307.8" n="1" level="3"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">flame-color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddit flammam excellentis purpurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant lumina (i. e. oculi) flammā,</quote> <trans><tr>his eyes glare with fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 300</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrā suffusus lumina flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 368</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18307.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fever-heat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 554</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, viz., acc. as the notion of glowing heat or of destructive power predominates (cf. flagro, II.).—</sense><sense id="n18307.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The flame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fire of passion</hi>, esp. of love, <hi rend="ital">the flame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glow of love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris turpissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncto concepit pectore flammam Funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excute virgineo conceptas pectore flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digne puer meliore flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira feri mota est: spirat pectore flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 355</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:295" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 295</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis illa vis et quasi flamma oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet non ceram illam neque figuram tantam vim in sese habere, sed memoria rerum gestarum eam flammam egregiis viris in pectore crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A devouring flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidi in ipsam flammam civilis discordiae vel potius belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is se tum eripuit flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implacatae gulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>raging hunger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 849</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18307.13" n="C" level="2"> Flamma Jovis, <hi rend="ital">the name of a red flower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 27, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18308" type="main" key="Flamma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flamma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammabundus: <entryFree id="n18309" type="main" key="flamma_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. flamma</etym>, <sense id="n18309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flaming</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammatrix: <entryFree id="n18310" type="main" key="flamma_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flammo</etym>, <sense id="n18310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that inflames</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 428</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammearius: <entryFree id="n18311" type="main" key="flamme^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flammeum, from flammeus</etym>, <sense id="n18311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of bridal-veils</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; cf.: flammearii, infectores flammei coloris, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
flammeolum: <entryFree id="n18312" type="main" key="flamme^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĕŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bridal veil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:334" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 334</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 449</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammeolus: <entryFree id="n18313" type="hapax" key="flamme^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [flammeus], <hi rend="ital">flame-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caltha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:307" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 307</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammesco: <entryFree id="n18314" type="hapax" key="flammesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. flamma], <hi rend="ital">to become inflamed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammescere caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 669</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammeus: <entryFree id="n18315" type="main" key="flamme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18315.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt stellae naturā flammeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">halitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18315.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flamecolored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammeum quod phlox vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:361" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 361</bibl></cit>: vestimentum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92</bibl> Müll.—Deriv., </sense><sense id="n18315.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18315.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A fiery red color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid flammei, aliquid lutei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18315.5" n="(b)" level="5"> = phlox, <hi rend="ital">the flame-red violet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18315.6" n="(g)" level="5"> (sc. velum), <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">flame-colored</hi>) <hi rend="ital">bridal-veil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae caput involvere flammeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammea texuntur sponsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:78:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 78, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:42:3" default="NO">12, 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 325</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 541 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Becker's Gall. 2, p. 24 sq.: lutea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 538</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 317</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammea conterit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>changes husbands repeatedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 225</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18315.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi> (ante- and post-class.): versus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 15</bibl> (Sat. 7, p. 155 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">acres et flammei viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
