flammicomans: <entryFree id="n18316" type="hapax" key="flammi^co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭcŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + como</etym>, <sense id="n18316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having fiery hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 25, 4, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammicomus: <entryFree id="n18317" type="hapax" key="flammi^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + coma</etym>, <sense id="n18317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having fiery hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 775</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 1089</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammicremus: <entryFree id="n18318" type="hapax" key="flammi^cre^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭcrĕmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + cremo</etym>, <sense id="n18318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consumed with fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> 1, 15, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammidus: <entryFree id="n18319" type="main" key="flammi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma</etym>, <sense id="n18319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi> (Appuleian): glacialibus flammida confundit, App. de Mundo, <cb n="FLAT" /> p. 66, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">roseo rubore flammida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Met. 11, p. 158, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammifer: <entryFree id="n18320" type="main" key="flammi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flame-bearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): fer mi auxilium; pestem abige a me, flammiferam hanc vim, quae me excruciat, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. 50 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">crinis (stellae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:55" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lit up by torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammigena: <entryFree id="n18321" type="hapax" key="flammi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flamma + gigno</etym>, <sense id="n18321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fire-born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cacus</tr>, <tr>son of Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 13, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammiger: <entryFree id="n18322" type="main" key="flammi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + gero</etym>, <sense id="n18322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flame-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the eagle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:676" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:582" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 582</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Titan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammigero: <entryFree id="n18323" type="main" key="flammi^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭgĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze</hi>, Ambros. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:Off. Min. 3:18:103 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Off. Min. 3, 18, 103 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
flammigo: <entryFree id="n18324" type="main" key="flammi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>flamma + ago</etym>, <sense id="n18324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit flames</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">noctu flammigare (Aetnam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammipes: <entryFree id="n18325" type="hapax" key="flammi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭ-pes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma</etym>, <sense id="n18325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fiery-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrijugi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 11, 4, 554</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammipotens: <entryFree id="n18326" type="hapax" key="flammi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + potens</etym>, <sense id="n18326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">powerful by fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammivolus: <entryFree id="n18327" type="hapax" key="flammi^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + volo</etym>, <sense id="n18327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying with flames</hi>: sol, Arator. Act. Apost. 2, 531.</sense></entryFree>
flammivomus: <entryFree id="n18328" type="main" key="flammi^vo^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammĭvŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flamma + vomo</etym>, <sense id="n18328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vomiting flames</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 23 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
flammo: <entryFree id="n18329" type="main" key="flammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. flamma]. </sense><sense id="n18329.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and perh. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">super raros feni flammantis acervos Traicit immundos ebria turba pedes (in the purifications at the Palilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 77 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:727" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 727</bibl> and <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 781</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">flammantia lumina torquens (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 433</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18329.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> also <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose).—</sense><sense id="n18329.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque igni flammata cremantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut interirent aut crucibus affixi aut flammandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax nubila flammans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:568" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 568</bibl></cit>: principio aetherio flammatus Juppiter igni Vertitur, <hi rend="ital">blazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 17.—</sense><sense id="n18329.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">to make flame-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to color red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius roseo flammatur purpura vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 297</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammata pudore juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:655" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammata toga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fiery red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18329.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic donis vulgum laudumque cupidine flammat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:303" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem facta ad Mavortia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammantur in hostem cornipedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:390" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his inter se vocibus instinctos flammavere insuper adlatae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes exercitus flammaverat arrogantia venientium a Vitellio militum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had inflamed with anger</tr>, <tr>incensed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">talia flammato secum dea corde volutans,</quote> <trans><tr>inflamed</tr>, <tr>angry mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsae flammatus amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:300" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 300</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:249" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 249</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flammosus: <entryFree id="n18330" type="main" key="flammo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">carbones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:174" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:32:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flammula: <entryFree id="n18331" type="main" key="flammu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flammŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little flame.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18331.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timagoras negat sibi umquam, cum oculum torsisset, duas ex lucerna flammulas esse visas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18331.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a little banner</hi> used by cavalry, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flamomenses: <entryFree id="n18332" type="main" key="Flamomenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flamomenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flatilis: <entryFree id="n18333" type="main" key="fla_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flo</etym>, <sense id="n18333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">produced by blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blown</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laminae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>founded</tr>, <tr>cast</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <trans><tr>blown in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 533</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 560</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
flato: <entryFree id="n18334" type="main" key="fla_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18334.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantores tibia calamoque flatantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18334.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Conf. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
flator: <entryFree id="n18335" type="main" key="fla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blower</hi> of a windinstrument: flator tibicen, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.; cf.: flat, flator <foreign lang="greek">fusa=|, au)lhth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.: flatores, tibicines a flando, <cb n="FLAV" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 463</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a caster of metals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumviri monetales, aeris, argenti, auri flatores,</quote> <trans><tr>a melter</tr>, <tr>coiner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flatura: <entryFree id="n18336" type="main" key="fla_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flo</etym>, <sense id="n18336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ventos jamdiu non esse, et caeli conquievisse flaturas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <trans><tr>a melting</tr>, <tr>coining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARGENTARIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaturalis: <entryFree id="n18337" type="hapax" key="fla_tu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flatura</etym>, <sense id="n18337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>containing air</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaturarius: <entryFree id="n18338" type="main" key="fla_tu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metal-caster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">money-coiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 9, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4192 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FABER,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4280</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flatus: <entryFree id="n18339" type="main" key="fla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flo</etym>, <sense id="n18339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snorting</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: flamen, flabra, ventus, aura). </sense><sense id="n18339.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum spissa nimis complere sedilia flatu (sc. tibiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatuque secundo, Carbasa mota sonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 418</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the wind,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 10</bibl>; also in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 339</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa sui flatus ne sonet aura, cavet,</quote> <trans><tr>of his breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:428" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equi) humescunt spumis flatuque sequentum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the snorting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 111</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris (with crepitus),</quote> <trans><tr>a breaking wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatu figuratur vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18339.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">the breath of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the soul</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 168.— </sense><sense id="n18339.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18339.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi> (the fig. being taken from wind): <cit><quote lang="la">cum prospero flatu fortunae utimur, ad exitus pervehimur optatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, unde aliquis flatus ostenditur, vela do,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18339.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">det libertatem fandi flatusque remittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 346</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 715</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:699" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 699</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:321" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flaveo: <entryFree id="n18340" type="main" key="fla_ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>flavus</etym>, <sense id="n18340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be golden yellow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gold-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be light yellow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): sed cum maturis flavebit messis aristis, Col. poët. 10, 311; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 124</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaventes cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clytius flavens prima lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 324</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flavesco: <entryFree id="n18341" type="main" key="fla_vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [flaveo], <hi rend="ital">to become golden yellow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gold-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn a light yellow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">molli paulatim flavescet campus arista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavescere haphe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:66:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 66, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of gold,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:24:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 703</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (ebur) flavescere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium fagi celerrime flavescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 47, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flavialis: <entryFree id="n18342" type="main" key="Fla_vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Flavius, II. B.</entryFree>
flavianus: <entryFree id="n18343" type="main" key="Fla_vi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Flavius, II. C.</entryFree>
flavicomans: <entryFree id="n18344" type="hapax" key="fla_vi^co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvĭcŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flavus + comans</etym>, <sense id="n18344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellow-haired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaxen-haired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 495</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flavicomus: <entryFree id="n18345" type="hapax" key="fla_vi^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flavus + coma</etym>, <sense id="n18345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellow-haired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaxen-haired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corymbion,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110</bibl></cit> (al. flavus).</sense></entryFree>
flavidus: <entryFree id="n18346" type="main" key="fla_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flavus</etym>, <sense id="n18346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a golden yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:20:194" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 20, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flavina: <entryFree id="n18347" type="main" key="Fla_vi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small city of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:492" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 492</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvīnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 698</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvīnĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Flavinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 696</bibl></cit> Serv.</sense></entryFree>
flavissae: <entryFree id="n18348" type="spur" key="flavissae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flavissae</orth>, a false reading in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 29</bibl>, for favissae, v. h. v.).</entryFree>
flavius: <entryFree id="n18349" type="main" key="Fla_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Flavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl>.— So in partic. Cn. Flavius, <hi rend="ital">the scribe of the pontifiex maximus</hi>, Appius Caecus, <hi rend="ital">who published the</hi> Fasti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. fasti. From the gens Flavia were descended the emperors Vespasian, Titus, and Domitian,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, Flavius ultimus for Domitianus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18349.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18349.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flā-vĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Flavius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>built by Domitian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:4:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:35:2" default="NO">9, 35, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18349.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the college of priests for the Flavian family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instituted by Domitian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Flavial-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FLAMEN,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PONTIFEX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">COMES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SEXVIR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">XVVIRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidentibus Diali sacerdote et collegio Flavialium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18349.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Flavius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Flavian</hi>: jus civile, <hi rend="ital">named after</hi> Cn. Flavius, <hi rend="ital">the publisher</hi> <pb n="758" /> <cb n="FLEC" /> <hi rend="ital">of the Fasti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the adherents of Vespasian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flavus: <entryFree id="n18350" type="main" key="fla_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for flag-vus from FLAG, flagro, burning, light-colored</etym>, <sense id="n18350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">golden yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaxen-colored</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">canqo/s</foreign> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis dulci flavoque liquore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 938</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: et te, flava comas, frugum mitissima mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 118</bibl></cit>: mare marmore flavo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 377 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galanthis flava comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavus comarum Curio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ganymedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phyllis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chloë,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: Tiberis, <hi rend="ital">reddish yellow</hi> (from the puzzolan earth on its ground), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; 1, 8, 8; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 18: Tiberinus multa flavus harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 447</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycormas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <trans><tr>blushing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 652" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus in flavum colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: an de moneta Caesaris decem flavos, <hi rend="ital">gold pieces</hi> (cf. Engl. <hi rend="ital">yellow-boys</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:65:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 65, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: flavior, Boëth. ap. Porphyr. Dial. 2, p. 31.</sense></entryFree>
flebilis: <entryFree id="n18351" type="main" key="fle_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fleo</etym>. <sense id="n18351.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wept over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be lamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ponite ante oculos miseram illam et flebilem speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o flebiles vigilias!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebile principium melior fortuna secuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 518</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis ille bonis flebilis occidit, Nulli flebilior, quam tibi, Vergili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18351.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18351.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">causes to weep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that brings tears</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): cepe, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 201, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebile dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:502" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 502</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18351.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doleful</hi> (class.): gemitus elamentabilis; <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillus, abjectus, flebilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror (est) aegritudo flebilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus vel concitati vel flebiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:162" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:170" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargebat tepidos flebilis imbre sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 125, 2</bibl></cit> Elm.—In <hi rend="ital">neut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebile, adverbially: exclusus flebile cantet amans,</quote> <trans><tr>dolefully</tr>, <tr>plaintively</tr>, <tr>sadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gavisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:426" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:648" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 648</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flēbĭlĭter</orth> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">mournfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dolefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quam non flebiliter respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">daemones flebilius ululant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flecto: <entryFree id="n18352" type="main" key="flecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flecto</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">folko/s</foreign>, bandy-legged; <foreign lang="greek">fa/lkhs</foreign>, the bent rib of a ship; L. falx; falco, so called from the curve of its claws or beak; cf. Germ. Falke; Engl. falcon</etym>. <sense id="n18352.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn round</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: plecto, plico, curvo). </sense><sense id="n18352.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18352.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animal omne membra quocumque vult, flectit, contorquet, porrigit, contrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus ad illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 265</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 236: lumina a gurgite in nullam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas acies huc,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn</tr>, <tr>direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 789</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos brevi moderari ac flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum de foro in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 447</bibl></cit>: navem, Auct. B. Alex. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:225" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 225</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus in laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad Privernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 13</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter Demetriadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (Bacche) flectis amnes, tu mare barbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 303</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flexos incurvant viribus arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexum genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexi crines,</quote> <trans><tr>curled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:6" default="NO">10, 65, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:493" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 493</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexum mare,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>a bay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexi fractique motus,</quote> <trans><tr>contorted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc (silva) se flectit sinistrorsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: quasi amnis celeris rapit, sed tamen inflexu flectitur, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 191, 34</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 42 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">(milvus) flectitur in gyrum,</quote> <trans><tr>wheels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo flector in anguem,</quote> <trans><tr>I bend</tr>, <tr>wind myself into a snake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:883" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 883</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol ab ea (Cancri) meta incipit flecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 264</bibl></cit>: Euphrates ad <cb n="FLEM" /> meridiem flectitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 125</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18352.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to go round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">double</hi> a promontory: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in flectendis promontoriis ventorum mutationes maximas saepe sentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucaten flectere molestum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18352.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18352.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere multimodis voces et flectere cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui teneros et rudes cum acceperunt, inficiunt et flectunt, ut volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitatem animorum torquere et flectere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam naturam huc et illuc torquere ac flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam flectere fingereque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes suas ad nostrum imperium nomenque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribentis animum a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> 5: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ab aliqua opinione flectendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ad publica carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: quo vobis mentes ... dementes sese flexere viaï? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 209 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">est viri et ducis oblata casu flectere ad consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis cereus in vitium flecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod procul a nobis flectat Fortuna gubernans,</quote> <trans><tr>turn aside</tr>, <tr>avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18352.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18352.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bend</hi> (in opinion or in will), <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soften</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moveo, afficio): quibus rebus ita flectebar animo atque frangebar, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid te oratione flectam? ... qua re flecte te, quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: facile Achivos flexeris, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 4, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 229 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flectere mollibus jam durum imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus si flecteris ullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flectere si nequeo Superos, Acheronta movebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 312</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi dii immortales suo numine prope fata ipsa flexissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desine fata deum flecti sperare precando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos commutare atque omni ratione flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium alicujus aversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem a proposito spes mollitiave animi flexisset,</quote> <trans><tr>divert</tr>, <tr>dissuade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: dictis nostris sententia flexa est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 264 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si flectitur ira deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 378</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortaturque simul flectitque labores,</quote> <trans><tr>soothes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:119" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deditionem primos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum valet miseratio, quae judicem flecti non tantum cogit, sed, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to let himself be moved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexi in misericordiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18352.8" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to I. A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To turn aside from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avoid</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam (viam) flectas, te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 18, 2</bibl></cit> (but B. and K. ex conj. C. F. Hermann read ira, v. a. sup.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flexit viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo a se flexos imputavit civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18352.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To refer to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apply to</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">versus qui in Tiberium flecterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus quaedam ex horrida illa antiquitate ad praesentem usum flexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18352.10" n="d" level="4"> In grammar. </sense><sense id="n18352.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To form</hi> a word from another language: <cit><quote lang="la">verba derivare, flectere, conjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vocabulum (pollex) de Graeco flexum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n18352.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjugate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:2:29 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, 2, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18352.13" n="(g)" level="5"> Flectere syllabam, <hi rend="ital">to mark with the circumflex accent</hi>, and hence, <hi rend="ital">to lengthen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl> Spald. and Zumpt.</sense><sense id="n18352.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">march</hi> in any direction (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18352.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum procul hos laevo flectentes limite cernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Gabino in Tusculanos flexere colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal ad Oceanum flectit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde Vitellius Cremonam flexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18352.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of thought or speech, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">ad providentiam sapientiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ambitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veneratione Augusti orsus flexit ad victorias Tiberii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18352.17" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zodiacus circa Cancrum Capricornumque flexior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 878</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. subst.</hi>: collium flexa, Minuc. Fel. Octav. 17.—</sense><sense id="n18352.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of tones, <hi rend="ital">lengthened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinito magis illa flexa et circumducta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flegma: <entryFree id="n18353" type="main" key="flegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flegma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. phlegma.</entryFree>
flemina: <entryFree id="n18354" type="main" key="fle_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flēmĭna</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (=<foreign lang="greek">flegmonh</foreign>), <sense id="n18354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bloody swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">congestion of blood about the</hi> <cb n="FLET" /> <hi rend="ital">ankles;</hi> flemina dicuntur, cum ex labore viae sanguis defluit circa talos, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudine invaserunt misera in genua flemina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bryonia in jumento homineque flemina sanat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fleo: <entryFree id="n18355" type="main" key="fle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flĕo</orth>, <itype>flēvi, flētum, 2</itype> (contr. forms flēsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>: <sense id="n18355.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">flēmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 291</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flērunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:175" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flēsset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flēsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 44, 7</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [for flev-o, root <foreign lang="greek">flu</foreign>-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">flu/w</foreign>, to bubble up, etc.; L. fluo, fluvius, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 301 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 301 sq.</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n18355.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18355.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed tears</hi> (syn.: ploro, lugeo, lacrimo): maerentes, flentes, lacrimantes, commiserantes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 442</bibl> P. (Ann. 107 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fleo, quia dijungimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin fles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium haec flet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fle, mulier!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fles, Asterie?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille me complexus atque osculans flere prohibebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum pluribus verbis flens a Caesare peteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 76, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 98, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deceptus quoniam flevit et ipse, deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 54: <cit><quote lang="la">felix qui potuit praesenti flere puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>before</tr>, <tr>in the presence of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o multa fleturum caput!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:74" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides mehercule omnes flere et lamentari coëgisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sepulcrum venimus: in ignem posita est: fletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus est, quod flendum meo nomine quam quod gaudendum illius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 8; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:52" default="NO">11, 1, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18355.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n18355.4" n="1" level="3"> Of horses, <hi rend="ital">to neigh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum greges comperit ubertim flere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18355.5" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickle</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uberibus flent omnia guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flevit in templis ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 702" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18355.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, a person or thing; <hi rend="ital">to sing mournfully</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; once in Cic.): <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Ne fle. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Egone illum non fleam? egone non defleam Talem adolescentem? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicum (filium) mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes Troĭlon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gygen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">amissas amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:96:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 96, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">* Pisonem eis verbis flens meum casum vexavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem tristem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissum conjugem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem mutatosque deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechos arrogantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catellam raptam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem testudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: feralia carmina, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 350: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissum fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:29:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlatum ad se Pompeii caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 10:32:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 32, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum fleti ad superos,</quote> <trans><tr>bewailed</tr>, <tr>lamented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 481</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18355.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina septem Flebis in aeterno surda jacere situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:633" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 633</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flē-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">weeping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater fleta et lacrimosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 199 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 631</bibl> the correct read. is sanguinolenti).</sense></entryFree>
fletifer: <entryFree id="n18356" type="hapax" key="fle_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flētĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. fletus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n18356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dripping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distilling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fletus: <entryFree id="n18357" type="main" key="fle_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fleo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18358" type="main" key="fle_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flētus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fleo</etym>, <sense id="n18358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamenting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): nemo me lacrimis decoret nec funera fletu Faxit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl> (Epigr. 1, 3, p. 162 ed. Vahl.); cf.: quantum fletum factum audivi! Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quod usque eo visum est indignum, ut urbe tota fletus gemitusque fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubris lamentatio fletusque maerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus cum singultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae fletu et dolore,</quote> <trans><tr>for tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduo fletu sororis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec magna cum misericordia fletuque pronuntiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore ac fletu omnia compleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum populo movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno fletu auxilium petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginum precibus et fletu excitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille erumpit fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: fletibus <pb n="759" /> <cb n="FLEX" /> natos, laetitia defunctos prosequi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis ille movetur fletibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 439</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18358.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., = lacrimae, <hi rend="ital">tears</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletu super ora refuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 658</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 673</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flevo: <entryFree id="n18359" type="main" key="Fle_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flēvo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Zuyder Zee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lake at the mouth of the Rhine</hi>, Mela, 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flēvom</orth> (sc. ostium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flevum: <entryFree id="n18360" type="main" key="Fle_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flēvum</orth>, sc. castellum, <sense id="n18360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress of the Frisii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west of the mouth of the Ems</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Flie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Flieland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>, v. Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
flexanimus: <entryFree id="n18361" type="main" key="flexa^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flecto + animus</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). <sense id="n18361.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that bends</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sways the heart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affecting</hi>: o flexanima atque omnium regina rerum oratio, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 177 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam vim habet illa, quae recte a bono poëta dicta est flexanima atque omnium regina rerum oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18361.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi>: flexanima, tamquam lymphata aut Bacchi sacris commota, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 80</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 422 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
flexibilis: <entryFree id="n18362" type="main" key="flexi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flexus, from flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexible</hi> (class.; cf.: lentus, flexilis). </sense><sense id="n18362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam rerum totam esse flexibilem et commutabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ulmus) ad currus flexibili vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18362.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18362.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractable</hi>: genera vocis permulta: grave, acutum; <cit><quote lang="la">flexibile, durum,</quote> <trans><tr>flexible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam flexibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:40" default="NO">40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil non flexibile ad bonitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18362.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">fickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse tam flexibile, tam devium, quam animus ejus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flexibilitas: <entryFree id="n18363" type="main" key="flexi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flexibilis</etym>, <sense id="n18363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flexibility</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cornuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
flexilis: <entryFree id="n18364" type="main" key="flexi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flexus, from flecto</etym>. <sense id="n18364.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pliable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus et fraxinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">betulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix ad circumspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18364.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 26</bibl>, read nexilis, Merk.).</sense></entryFree>
