flexiloquus: <entryFree id="n18365" type="hapax" key="flexi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flexus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n18365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equivocal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oracula) partim falsa, partim casu vera, partim flexiloqua et obscura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flexio: <entryFree id="n18366" type="main" key="flexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning; a bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n18366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunco toto se ipse moderans et virili laterum flexione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18366.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18366.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deverticula flexionesque quaesisti!</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turnings</tr>, <tr>windings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18366.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of the voice, <hi rend="ital">a modulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in dicendo etiam quidam cantus obscurior ... quem significat Demosthenes et Aeschines, cum alter alteri obicit vocis flexiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicatiores in cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cervices oculosque pariter cum modorum flexionibus torquent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flexipes: <entryFree id="n18367" type="hapax" key="flexi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭ-pes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flexus, from flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with crooked feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae,</quote> <trans><tr>clinging</tr>, <tr>clasping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flexivice: <entryFree id="n18368" type="hapax" key="flexi^vi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexĭvĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>flexus-vicis</etym>, <sense id="n18368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with turnings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">windings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crookedly</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 260, 11</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 152 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
flexo: <entryFree id="n18369" type="hapax" key="flexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>flexus, from flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
flexuntes: <entryFree id="n18370" type="gloss" key="flexuntes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexuntes</orth>, <sense id="n18370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old name of the Roman knights</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum nomen saepe variatum est. ... Celeres sub Romulo regibusque appellati sunt, deinde flexuntes, postea trossuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 9, § 35</bibl></cit> Sillig. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 606</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flexuose: <entryFree id="n18371" type="main" key="flexu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. flexuosus <sense id="n18371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
flexuosus: <entryFree id="n18372" type="main" key="flexu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. flexus</etym>, <sense id="n18372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of turns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">windings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tortuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18372.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexuosum iter habet auditus, ne quid intrare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus hirundini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 24, 35</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FLO" /> § 73.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina flexuosissimis orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 143</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flexu-ōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tortuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si flexuose volitet flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 84, § 357</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flexura: <entryFree id="n18373" type="main" key="flexu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flexus, from flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18373.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiae flexuraeque vicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18373.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus recta est: flexuram non recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18373.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gram., <hi rend="ital">inflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declension</hi> of a word, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 28</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
flexus: <entryFree id="n18374" type="main" key="flexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from flecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18375" type="main" key="flexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flecto</etym>, <sense id="n18375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> (class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n18375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures duros et quasi corneolos habent introitus, multisque cum flexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:13:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 13, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui cursu parum valent, flexu eludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum venissem ad pontem, in quo flexus est ad iter Arpinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo flexu viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicatae flexibus vallium viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus modico flexu in occidentem versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexu Armeniam petivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio flexu reduci ad viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quo pacto sol) Brumales adeat flexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metae,</quote> <trans><tr>the turn round the goal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:63" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labyrinthei,</quote> <trans><tr>the mazes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli dociles et centum flexibus apti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: in litore flexus Mecybernaeus, <hi rend="ital">the bay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gulf</hi>, Mela, 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18375.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18375.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transition</hi> into another state, <hi rend="ital">political change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id enim est caput civilis prudentiae, videre itinera flexusque rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc flexu quasi aetatis fama adolescentis paululum haesit ad metas (the figure taken from the turning of the racers on reaching the goal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si infinitus forensium rerum labor decursu honorum et jam aetatis flexu constitisset, i. e. senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexu auctumni (= post medium tempus auctumni, trop. from turning the meta in the Circus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; v. Orell. ad h. 1.—</sense><sense id="n18375.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18375.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An artful turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shifting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde recta fere est actio, hinc mille flexus et artes desiderantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec recta tantum, et in nullos flexus recedentia tractaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18375.6" n="2" level="3"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">inflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharoedi simul et sono vocis et plurimis flexibus serviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quoque flexu dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui flexus deceat miserationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:3" default="NO">1, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18375.7" n="3" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">inflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derivation</hi> (in Varro flexura, v. h. v.): quid vero? quae tota positionis ejusdem in diversos flexus eunt? cum Alba faciat Albanos et Albenses; <cit><quote lang="la">volo, volui et volavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flictus: <entryFree id="n18376" type="main" key="flictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fligo</etym>, <sense id="n18376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dashing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collision</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): armamentūm stridor, flictus navium, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 667</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 335 ed. Rib.): tum scuta cavaeque Dant sonitum flictu galeae, Verg. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:322" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 322</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fligo: <entryFree id="n18377" type="main" key="fli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flīgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fla/w, fli/bw</foreign>, = <foreign lang="greek">qla/w, qli/bw</foreign>,, to crush; Lat. flagellum; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flagitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 477" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 477</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n18377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike down</hi> (ante-class.): fligi affligi: ipsus se in terram saucius fligit cadens, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 29 sq.</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 12 Rib.); so Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (v. 317 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1001</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. lidebant or laedebant; v. Munro ad loc. 3d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
flo: <entryFree id="n18378" type="main" key="flo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flo</orth>, <itype>flāvi, flātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root fla-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)k-flai/nw</foreign>, to stream forth; <foreign lang="greek">flasmo/s</foreign>, vain-glorying; hence, Lat. flatus, flabrum, etc., flos, flōreo, Flōra; Germ. blasen, blähen; <cit><quote lang="la">Eng. blow, bloom, blast, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 301" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 301</bibl></cit>; cf. Grimm, Wörterb. s. v. blähen, blasen]. </sense><sense id="n18378.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spiro, halo): belle nobis flavit ab Epiro lenissimus ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corus ventus in his locis flare consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiae contra fluvium flantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinam flaturi sint venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflexo Berecynthia tibia cornu Flabit,</quote> <trans><tr>will blow</tr>, <tr>sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:181" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 181</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: simul <cb n="FLOR" /> flare sorbereque haud factu facile'st: ego hic esse et illic simitu hau potui, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to do two opposite things at once</hi>, as we say, <hi rend="ital">to blow hot and cold with the same breath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18378.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow up</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">blow away</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18378.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hieme anima, quae flatur, omnium apparet,</quote> <trans><tr>which is emitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: Chimaera Ore foras acrem flaret de corpore flammam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 906</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis vento flatus, Auct. B. Afr. 52, 4: tibia flatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is blown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:341" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygius lapis flatur follibus, donec rubescat,</quote> <trans><tr>is blown upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 36, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18378.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coin</hi> metals by blowing: <cit><quote lang="la">aes antiquissimum, quod est flatum, pecore est notatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flata signataque pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the directors of the mint</hi> were called triumviri auro argento aeri flando feriundo (abbrev. III. VIRI A. A. A. F. F.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 569</bibl>; v. ferio.—</sense><sense id="n18378.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omisso magna semper flandi tumore,</quote> <trans><tr>of high-flown</tr>, <tr>bombastic talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: spernere succina, flare rosas, Fulva monilia respuere, qs. <hi rend="ital">to blow away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 21.</sense></entryFree>
flocces: <entryFree id="n18379" type="main" key="flocces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flocces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dregs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">less of wine</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flocces audierat prisca voce significare vini faecem e vinaceis expressam, sicuti fraces ex oleis, idque apud Caecilium in Polumenis legerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: neque florem, neque flocces volo mihi, vinum volo, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 17</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 190 Rib.): apludam edit et flocces bibit, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floccosus: <entryFree id="n18380" type="main" key="flocco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">floccōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>floccus</etym>, <sense id="n18380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of flocks of wool</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floccus: <entryFree id="n18381" type="main" key="floccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">floccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flock</hi> (of wool, on clothes, in fruits, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qui flocci intereant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomis substrati flocci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veste floccos legere fimbriasve diducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilulae intus habentes floccos molles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">something trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of no account</hi> (most freq., esp. with negatives, and in the phrase flocci facere, <hi rend="ital">to make no account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to care not a straw for;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n18381.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum qui sis, qui non sis, floccum non interduim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 152</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, ciccum; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eluas tu an exungare, ciccum non interduim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego illum maneo, neque flocci facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is leno flocci non fecit fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, quae tu loquere, flocci non facio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus aveo scire, nec tamen flocci facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam rem publicam flocci non facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: quare, ut opinor, <foreign lang="greek">filosofhte/on</foreign>, id quod tu facis, et istos consulatus non flocci facteon, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 13</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (but here Ernesti reads <foreign lang="greek">e)ate/on</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">satin abiit, neque quod dixi flocci existimat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: invidere omnes mihi, Mordere clanculum; <cit><quote lang="la">ego non flocci pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18381.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Without a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi> (ante-class.), <hi rend="ital">to account of slight value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of small importance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem, famam flocci fecit, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. obstinato, p. 193, 11 Müll.: tu istos minutos cave deos flocci feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flocci facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 11</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: flocci fiet. Culi cultor, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 33</bibl>: rogata fuerit nec ne, flocci aestimo, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. muneralis, p. 143 Müll.: flocci pendo, quid rerum geras, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Exp. Serm. p. 565, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floces: <entryFree id="n18382" type="main" key="flo^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŏces</orth>, v. flocces.</entryFree>
flora: <entryFree id="n18383" type="main" key="Flo_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flos, v. flo</etym>, <sense id="n18383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose festival was celebrated on the 28th of April</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often with unbridled license</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:195 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 195 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 45, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 739</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia Florae aulaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:262 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 262 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18383.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. * </sense><sense id="n18383.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Flora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud M. Catonem in re Floria ita scriptum,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting the festival of Flora</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n18383.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18383.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Flora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Floral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97, p. 80" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, p. 80</bibl> Bip.—</sense><sense id="n18383.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the festival of Flora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the Floralia</hi>: sacrum, <pb n="760" /> <cb n="FLOR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:947" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 947</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignissima tuba Florali matrona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:250" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2545</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium and ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Flora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Florae ludi Floralia instituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(prisci) Floralia IIII. Kal. Mai. instituerunt urbis anno DXIII. ex oraculis Sibyllae, ut omnia bene deflorescerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro Floralium, non Floraliorum ait, cum non ludos Florales illic, sed ipsum festum, Floralia, significaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:178" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 178</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solenni Floraliorum die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18383.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flō-rālĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the feast of Flora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Floralicias lasset arena feras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>designed for the combats exhibited during the festival of Flora</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:67:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 67, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18383.7" n="1" level="3"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>flos</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a flowergarden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floralia: <entryFree id="n18384" type="main" key="Flo_ra_li^a" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Flora, II. B.</entryFree>
florens: <entryFree id="n18385" type="main" key="flo_rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from floreo.</entryFree>
florenter: <entryFree id="n18386" type="main" key="flo_renter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flourishingly;</hi> v. floreo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
florentia: <entryFree id="n18387" type="main" key="Flo_renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the river Arno</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Florence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 112" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 112</bibl> Goes.; cf. Zumpt, de Colon. p. 253.— </sense><sense id="n18387.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18387.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18387.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōren-tīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Florentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Florentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Florentia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flō-rentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Florentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Florentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floreo: <entryFree id="n18388" type="main" key="flo_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bloom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blossom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flower</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense; cf.: floresco, vigeo). </sense><sense id="n18388.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per terras frondent atque omnia florent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 214</bibl></cit>: florere omnia, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec arbor una (lentiscus) ter floret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possetne uno tempore florere, deinde vicissim horrere terra?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imputata floret usque vinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:44" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea, segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:263 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 263 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narcisso floreat alnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes ferulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene floreat annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:327" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 327</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18388.3" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to flos, I. B.) Of wine, <hi rend="ital">to froth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vinum florere incipiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina quoque in magnis operose condita cellis Florent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:270" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 270</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get the first downy beard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libat florentes haec tibi prima (dies) genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be filled with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound with</hi> any thing (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): mare velis florere videres, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 185</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare velivolis florebat puppibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1442</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc laetas urbes pueris florere videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 255</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hybla multis thymis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pridem regio ... undat equis floretque viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:547" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 547</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18388.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bloom</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be bright with varied colors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampineo gravidus autumno Floret ager, of the ripening fruits,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an army on the march: variis floret via discolor armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:565" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 565</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">floret cristatus exercitus undique turmis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be bright</hi> (cf. <pos>P. a.</pos> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">lumina floruisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum luminibus floruisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be in a flourishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prosperous condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in good repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, etc.; constr. with the <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18388.9" n="A" level="2"> Of persons and animate things. </sense><sense id="n18388.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sua patria multis virtutibus ac beneficiis floruit princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatis officiis et ingenii laude floruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni genere virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum acumine ingenii tum admirabili quodam lepore dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus et rerum gestarum gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā, auctoritate, gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitate discipulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus copiis (Crotoniatae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria genera dicendi, quibus quidam floruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re militari Epaminondas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vir, qui in Curia, in Rostris, in re publica floruisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententis senatoriis et in omni actione atque administratione rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="FLOR" /> </sense><sense id="n18388.12" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo in Graecia musici floruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">floret Epicurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inter illos florebas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multis simul floruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floruit circa Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10</bibl></cit>. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">circum tribus actis impiger annis Floret equus,</quote> <trans><tr>is in his bloom</tr>, <tr>prime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 884</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.13" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things. </sense><sense id="n18388.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vetus (Graecia), quae quondam opibus, imperio, gloria floruit, hoc uno malo concidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: familia, quae postea viris fortissimis floruit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctissimorum hominum familiaritates, quibus semper domus nostra floruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus ad urbem accessus incredibili hominum multitudine et gratulatione florebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:63:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 63, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid floret laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1279</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (magna Graecia) nunc quidem deleta est, tunc florebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae familia admodum floruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum auctoritas maxime florebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria generis floret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum vetus interit aetas, Et juvenum ritu florent modo nata vigentque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetherii dono cessere parentes Aeternum florere genas,</quote> <trans><tr>to shine in perpetual bloom</tr>, <tr>perpetual youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:705" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 705</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flō-rens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18388.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glistening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius et Lucretius florere dicunt omne quod nitidum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernarum florentia lumina flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 450</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi arcano igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:276" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes arcano lumine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus insignibus argenteis et aureis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abounding in flowers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertice de summo semper florentis Hymetti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 702</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">florens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garland</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">do hanc tibi florentem florenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n18388.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">flourishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the prime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18388.19" n="1" level="3"> Of animate things. </sense><sense id="n18388.20" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti hominem florentem aetate, opibus, honoribus, ingenio, liberis, propinquis, affinibus, amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia atque hospitiis florens hominum nobilissimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina Berenice florens aetate formaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo florentes aetatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui te beatum, qui florentem putas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego florentis atque integros sine ferro viceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores florentes et leviter ornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florens et illustris adolescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: exorta semper florentis Homeri species, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 124</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrentes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the prosperous</hi> (opp. afflicti), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.22" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. things. </sense><sense id="n18388.23" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes viribus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:226" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 226</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anni vigore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus vino,</quote> <trans><tr>joyous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18388.24" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(majores nostri) ex minima tenuissimaque re publica maximam et florentissimam nobis reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas (Ubiorum) ampla atque florens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidetur praestanti florentique fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florens amicitia (opp. afflicta),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo consilio florentissimis rebus domos suas Helvetii reliquissent, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neu florentes res suas cum Jugurthae perditis misceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes Etruscorum opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentissima Samnitium castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus florenti aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1074</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo florente puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1008" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1008</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc florente juventa Fervidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentissima ejus erat aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: nostrum opus tibi probari laetor: ex quo <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqh</foreign> ipsa posuisti, quae mihi florentiora sunt visa tuo judicio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modus nullus est florentior in singulis verbis (quam translatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio florentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:28:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 28, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: florentis facundiae homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 9, 2</bibl></cit> —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">flourishingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famously</hi> (late Lat.): florentissime docet, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with great repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrity</hi>, Hier. Chron. Euseb. an. 358.</sense></entryFree>
floresco: <entryFree id="n18389" type="main" key="flo_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [floreo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to blossom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come out in blossom</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18389.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: antequam (plantae) gemmas<cb n="FLOR" />  agant et florescere incipiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">florescunt tempore certo arbusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puleium aridum florescere ipso brumali die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18389.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to flourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow into repute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite hunc nunc primum florescentem pervertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (Hortensio) florescente, Cassius est mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui quidem ad summam gloriam eloquentiae florescenti ferro erepta vita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit> (efflorescenti, Orell.).—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">patria nostra florescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa senescere, at haec contra florescere cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:895" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 895</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18389.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To abound in</hi> (cf. floreo, I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">armata florescant pube novales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:77" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 77</bibl></cit>.!*? The <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi> in neuter signif.: EODEM DIE (i. e. IV. Calend. Mai.) AEDIS FLORAE, QVAE REBVS FLORESCENDIS PRAEEST, DEDICATA EST, Calend. Praenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 389</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
floreus: <entryFree id="n18390" type="main" key="flo_re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of flowers</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n18390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>a wreath of flowers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit> (22 M.); 1, 2, 14.—</sense><sense id="n18390.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Full of flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <trans><tr>flowery meads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga Hymetti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:344" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 344</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18390.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>: crines, Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 605</bibl>: lanugo, Att. ib. (al. flora).</sense></entryFree>
florianus: <entryFree id="n18391" type="main" key="Flo_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> Esp., M. Annius, <hi rend="ital">half-brother of the emperor Tacitus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whose death he usurped the empire</hi>, A. D. 276, <hi rend="ital">but after a few weeks met an obscure death at Tarsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 36:37" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 36, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 10</bibl>; v. esp. Vop. Flor.</sense></entryFree>
floricomus: <entryFree id="n18392" type="main" key="flo_ri^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos + coma</etym>, <sense id="n18392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crowned with flowers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1000</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floride: <entryFree id="n18393" type="main" key="flo_ri^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. floridus <sense id="n18393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
floridulus: <entryFree id="n18394" type="hapax" key="flo_ri^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [floridus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat blooming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore floridulo nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floridus: <entryFree id="n18395" type="main" key="flo_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding with flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowery</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydrauli hortabere, ut audiat voces potius quam Platonis? expones, quae spectet, florida et varia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <trans><tr>garlands of flowers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:312" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 785</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Hybla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18395.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18395.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galatea Floridior prato, longa procerior alno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>the bloom of youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novitas mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 943</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florida et vegeta forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius Phalereus est floridior, ut ita dicam, quam Hyperides,</quote> <trans><tr>flowery</tr>, <tr>florid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>; cf.: tertium (dicendi genus) alii medium ex duobus, alii floridum (namque id <foreign lang="greek">a)nqhro\n</foreign> appellant) addiderunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">floridius genus (scriptorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floridissimus tui sermonis afflatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floridior in declamando quam in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4 praef.</bibl></cit> 5. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭde</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">depicta vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesia clarius ac floridius enituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
florifer: <entryFree id="n18396" type="main" key="flo_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowery</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 290</bibl></cit> (v. floriger).</sense></entryFree>
florifertum: <entryFree id="n18397" type="gloss" key="flo_ri^fertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭfertum</orth> <itype>dictum, quod eo die spicae feruntur ad sacrarium</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91, 10</bibl> Müll.; cf.: FLORIFERTVM, <foreign lang="greek">a)nqofori/a</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
florigenus: <entryFree id="n18398" type="hapax" key="flo_ri^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos + gigno</etym>, <sense id="n18398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing blossoms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blossoming</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the first hairs of the beard: malae, Poët. in Anth. Lat. II. p. 633 ed. Burm.</sense></entryFree>
floriger: <entryFree id="n18399" type="main" key="flo_ri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos+gero</etym>, <sense id="n18399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flower - bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowery</hi> (post - class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 290</bibl></cit> (Weber, al. florifer): <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the garden of Eden</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Venant. Carm. 3, 9, 1.</sense></entryFree>
florilegus: <entryFree id="n18400" type="hapax" key="flo_ri^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos+lego</etym>, <sense id="n18400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flower-culling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 366</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floriparus: <entryFree id="n18401" type="hapax" key="flo_ri^pa^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭpărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos+pario</etym>, <sense id="n18401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing flowers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floritio: <entryFree id="n18402" type="hapax" key="flo_ri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>floreo</etym>, <sense id="n18402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blossoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Homil. 2</bibl>, in Cantic.</sense></entryFree>
florius: <entryFree id="n18403" type="main" key="Flo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Flora, II. A. <pb n="761" /> <cb n="FLOS" /></entryFree>
florosus: <entryFree id="n18404" type="main" key="flo_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in flowers</hi>, Venant. Carm. 5, 6, 7.</sense></entryFree>
florulentus: <entryFree id="n18405" type="main" key="flo_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in flowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowery</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n18405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymettus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7</bibl></cit>: purpurae, i. e. rosae purpureae, Auct. Pervig. Ven. 19.—</sense><sense id="n18405.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>: succuba, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 191: pomposae facundiae florulenta germina, Venant. praef. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
florus: <entryFree id="n18406" type="main" key="flo_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">equus florā et comanti jubā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: crines, lanugo (al. florei and florea); v. floreus, II.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18407" type="main" key="Flo_rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So esp., </sense><sense id="n18407.1" n="I" level="1"> Julius Florus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated orator of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of</hi> Portius Latro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl> Spald.; perh. the same to whom the three epistles of the 1st book and the two of the 2d book of the Epistles of Horace are addressed.—</sense><sense id="n18407.2" n="II" level="1"> Florus, called in some MSS. L. Annaeus, in others Julius, <hi rend="ital">who compiled a brief history of Rome; he probably wrote in the time of Hadrian;</hi> v. Dict. of Biogr. 2, p. 176 sq.; Teuffel, Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 786 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18407.3" n="III" level="1"> Gessius Florus, <hi rend="ital">procurator of Judaea in the reign of Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18407.4" n="IV" level="1"> Julius Florus, <hi rend="ital">a nobleman of the Treviri</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leader of revolt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
flos: <entryFree id="n18408" type="main" key="flo_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flōs</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root fla-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)k-flai/nw</foreign>, to stream forth; cf. <foreign lang="greek">flasmo/s</foreign>; Lat. flare, flamen, etc., v. flo</etym>, <sense id="n18408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blossom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18408.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suaves flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat novos decerpere flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 928</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum omnium varietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas odorum, qui afflarentur e floribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetissimi flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ninguntque rosarum Floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores rosae, rosarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piabunt floribus et vino Genium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fons Bandusiae, dulci digne mero non sine floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidum caput impedire myrto Aut flore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte necne crocum floresque perambulet Attae Fabula, si dubitem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the stage strewed with flowers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carduus florem purpureum mittit inter medios aculeos,</quote> <trans><tr>puts forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 315</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18408.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18408.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The honey of flowers</hi> sucked out by the bees: <cit><quote lang="la">rure levis verno flores apis ingerit alveo, Conpleat ut dulci sedula melle favos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 7, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18408.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqos</foreign>, for whatever forms either the best part or the highest part of a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose).—</sense><sense id="n18408.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The flower</hi> of any thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the prime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">best part</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">the best kind</hi> of any thing: postquam est honoratus frugum et floris Liberi, <hi rend="ital">the bouquet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor of wine</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vini (Bacchi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 221</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The best kind of oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 23</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of rosin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of salt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of meal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl> et saep.; <hi rend="ital">of cream</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the finest dish</hi>: cenae, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18408.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The highest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi> of a thing.—Of <hi rend="ital">the froth of wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 136</bibl>.—The <hi rend="ital">blisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scales</hi> that are formed in smelting metals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the upper dust</hi> of marble or gypsum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">the first downy hairs of the beard</hi>: nunc primum opacat flore lanugo genas, Pac. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. genas, p. 94 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 562</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante genas dulces quam flos juvenilis inumbret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Prob. Cons.
