Pan. 69</bibl></cit>.—Donec flammai fulserunt flore coorto, <hi rend="ital">a tip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flash of flame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:900" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 900</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18408.7" n="3" level="3"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">carved flowers placed as ornaments on a Corinthian capital</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">on a cupola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 8</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n18408.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi> of any thing (class.; a favorite flg. of Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18408.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea tempestate flos poëtarum fuit (Plautus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic omnis fetus repressus, exustusque siti flos veteris ubertatis exaruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ennius) flos delibatus populi ... qua (eloquentia) virum excellentem praeclare tum illi homines florem populi esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 58</bibl></cit> sq. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 309" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 309</bibl> ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">flos nobilitatis ac juventutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cb n="FLUC" /> legatorum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versaris in optimorum civium vel flore vel robore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod floris, quod roboris in juventute fuerat, amiserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex morbo velut renovatus flos juventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 35, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia Galliae ... ille flos Italiae, illud firmamentum imperii populi Romani, illud ornamentum dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te, Crasse, cum vitae flore, tum mortis opportunitate, divino consilio et ortum et exstinctum esse arbitror,</quote> <trans><tr>splendor</tr>, <tr>glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso Graeciae flore,</quote> <trans><tr>in the very flower</tr>, <tr>the most flourishing condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos aetatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the flower of one's age</tr>, <tr>the prime of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 770</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:847" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 847</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non venirem contra gratiam, non virtutis spe, sed aetatis flore collectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— Without aetas: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Anni? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Anni? Sedecim. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Flos ipse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridissimo flore puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flore primo tantae indolis juvenis exstinctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flore virium se credens esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus flos animi,</quote> <trans><tr>youthful vigor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:625" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 625</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also: flos animi,</quote> <trans><tr>ripe age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus Vergilium ea de causa hortorum dotes fugisse, et e tantis, quae retulit, flores modo rerum decerpsisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the choicest</tr>, <tr>best</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14 praef.</bibl></cit> § 7.—</sense><sense id="n18408.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: flos aetatis, <hi rend="ital">maidenly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">youthful innocence</hi> (of girls or boys), <hi rend="ital">virginity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virgo) cum castum amisit polluto corpore florem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal flore aetatis, uti ferunt, primo Hamilcari conciliatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem aetatis (Caesaris) in Bithynia contaminatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18408.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">a flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut porro conspersa sit (oratio) quasi verborum sententiarumque floribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos aut lumen eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus flos tamen neque lumen ullum (in M. Crassi oratione),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem et colorem defuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 87, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia copia locuples, alia floribus laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male audire ... nimiis floribus et ingenii affluentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floscellus: <entryFree id="n18409" type="hapax" key="floscellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">floscellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a floweret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad solis cursum floscelli se vertunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
floscule: <entryFree id="n18410" type="hapax" key="floscu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">floscŭle</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>flosculus</etym>, <sense id="n18410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bloomingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus floscule vividum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:6:50" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flosculus: <entryFree id="n18411" type="main" key="floscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">floscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">floscŭ-la</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 6</bibl>), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n18411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">floweret</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n18411.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta omnia celeriter tamquam flosculi decidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18411.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the part of a fruit where the blossom was</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18411.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim flosculos ... sed, jam decimum aetatis ingressus annum, certos atque deformatos fructus ostenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18411.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech. </sense><sense id="n18411.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Flower of rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes undique flosculos carpere atque delibare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenibus flosculos omnium partium in ea, quae sunt dicturi, congerentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:22" default="NO">2, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO">12, 10, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Noctes istae quadam tenus his quoque historiae flosculis leviter injectis aspergerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18411.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A motto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi> culled from a writing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flovios: <entryFree id="n18412" type="main" key="flovios"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flovios</orth>, v. fluvius <sense id="n18412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
flucticola: <entryFree id="n18413" type="hapax" key="flucti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n18413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living in waves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flucticolor: <entryFree id="n18414" type="hapax" key="flucti^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭ-cŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus</etym>, <sense id="n18414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seacolored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profunditas hyacinthi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flucticulus: <entryFree id="n18415" type="hapax" key="flucti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavelet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctifragus: <entryFree id="n18416" type="hapax" key="flucti^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus+ frango</etym>, <sense id="n18416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-breaking</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of a coast: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 305</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctigena: <entryFree id="n18417" type="main" key="flucti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fluctus+gigno</etym>, <sense id="n18417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born in the waves</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nereus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 889</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctigenus: <entryFree id="n18418" type="main" key="flucti^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born in the waves</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctiger: <entryFree id="n18419" type="hapax" key="flucti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus+ gero</etym>, perh. <sense id="n18419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wave impelling</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of a ship: paro, Cic. Poët. <cb n="FLUC" /> Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 20</bibl> (IV. 2, p. 572 sq. ed. Orell.; G. Hermann conjectures fluctiseco).</sense></entryFree>
fluctio: <entryFree id="n18420" type="main" key="flucti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fluo; cf. fluctus</etym>, <sense id="n18420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi> (freq. in Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluctione occulta laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 49, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:73" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 21, § 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 73, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 5, 53, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctiones quas Graeci rheumatismos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctisonus: <entryFree id="n18421" type="main" key="flucti^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus+sonus</etym>, <sense id="n18421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-resounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring with waves</hi> (post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 836" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 836</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctivagus: <entryFree id="n18422" type="main" key="flucti^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus+vagus</etym>, <sense id="n18422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">driven about by the waves</hi> (post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 271</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flucto: <entryFree id="n18423" type="spur" key="flucto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flucto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 77</bibl>, instead of flutant; v. fluito).</entryFree>
fluctuabundus: <entryFree id="n18424" type="main" key="fluctu^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>fluctuor</etym>, <sense id="n18424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vacillating</hi>, Ambros. de Job, 4, 10, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fluctuatim: <entryFree id="n18425" type="hapax" key="fluctu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fluctuo</etym>, <sense id="n18425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flauntingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuatim jactanter et solute. Afranius Pompa: magnifice volo, fluctuatim ire ad illum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 29 sq.</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Fr. Com. v. 237" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Fr. Com. v. 237</bibl> Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
fluctuatio: <entryFree id="n18426" type="main" key="fluctu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vibrating to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fluctuation</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare). </sense><sense id="n18426.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wavering motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>: tunc artus trepidi, inquietae manus, totius corporis fluctuatio, Sen. de Ira, 2, 35, 3.—</sense><sense id="n18426.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacillation</hi> of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea fluctuatione animorum opprimi incautos posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 40, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctuo: <entryFree id="n18427" type="main" key="fluctu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, or</itype> (perh. not anteAug.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (pleraque utroque modo efferuntur: <sense id="n18427.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">fluctuatur, fluctuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fluctus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to move in the manner of waves</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise in waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be driven hither and thither</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.; cf.: fluo, fluito). </sense><sense id="n18427.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18427.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form fluctuo: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc valide fluctuat mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fluctuare video vehementer mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 2, 11: quadriremem in salo fluctuantem reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam commune quam mare fluctuantibus, litus ejectis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agebatur huc illuc Galba vario turbae fluctuantis impulsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuet aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 367</bibl></cit>: directaeque acies ac late fluctuat omnis Aere renidenti tellus, <hi rend="ital">waves</hi> (in the light) <hi rend="ital">with gleaming brass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuant insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 699" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 699</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 19, 4</bibl>; cf. fluctus, I. —</sense><sense id="n18427.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fluctuor: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensi in mari Syrtico modo in sicco relinquuntur, modo fluctuantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are driven about by the waves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos diu fluctuata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam insulae semper fluctuantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 94, 95, § 209</bibl></cit> Jan.: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum in longitudinem fluctuatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>floats about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem e Scyro insula integrum fluctuari tradunt, eundem comminutum mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 26, § 130</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18427.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful; to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swell; to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacillate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluctuate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18427.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Form fluctuo: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Potin, ut animo sis tranquillo? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quid si animus fluctuat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animo nunc huc, nunc fluctuat illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens animi tantis fluctuat ipsa malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis curarum fluctuat undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnoque irarum fluctuat aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 178, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuat ira intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irarum fluctuat aestu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 564</bibl></cit>; so, curarum, 8, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1077" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1077</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti Telamon fluctuat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:637" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuante rege inter spem metumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam aciem suo pavore fluctuantem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo decreto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuantem sententiam confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis, quod appellamus fluctuans et dissolutum, eo quod sine nervis et articulis fluctuat huc et illuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia et citata et fluctuantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18427.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fluctuor: <cit><quote lang="la">utrius populi mallet victoriam esse, fluctuatus animo fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuatus animo est, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl>: vita fluctuatur per adversa et difficilia, Sen. Ep. <pb n="762" /> <cb n="FLUE" /> 111: semper inter spem et metum fluctuari, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosia (herba) vagi nominis est et circa alias herbas fluctuati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctuosus: <entryFree id="n18428" type="main" key="fluctu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluctus</etym>, <sense id="n18428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billowy</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n18428.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mari fluctuoso,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18428.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with wave-like streaks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluctus: <entryFree id="n18429" type="main" key="fluctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (ante-class. form of the <sense id="n18429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> fluctuis, Varr. and Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> flucti, Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 12</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fluo; cf. fluctio</etym>, the peculiar motion of fluids, <hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waving.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18429.1" n="I" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">abstr.</hi> (rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unda, fluentum): jactetur aquae fluctu quoque terra vacillans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:554 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 554 sq.</bibl></cit>—Of the flowing motion of the magnetic fluid (v. aestus): <cit><quote lang="la">Cogitur offensare pulsareque fluctu Ferrea texta suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1053" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1053</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1271</bibl>; cf. fluctuo, I. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood.</hi>—In concr., <hi rend="ital">a wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surge</hi>, esp. of the sea (the predom. signif. of the word in prose and poetry; esp. freq. in the <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n18429.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: fons aquae dulcis, qui fluctu totus operiretur, nisi, etc., <hi rend="ital">the flood</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">high tide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl>: alia fluctus differt, dissipat visceratim membra, Maria salsa spumant sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 18</bibl> (Trag. v. 144 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab saxo avortit fluctus ad litus scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctum a saxo frangi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus uti ... volutus Ad terras immane sonat per saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fluctum aiunt declamare solitum Demosthenem, ut fremitum assuesceret voce vincere,</quote> <trans><tr>to the waves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18429.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: indu mari magno fluctus extollere certant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 425 ed. Vahl.): mulserat huc navim compulsam fluctibus pontus, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 257 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">excitatis maximis fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(insulae) fluctibus cinctae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilia, quae cincta Gallorum gentibus barbariae fluctibus alluitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese fluctibus committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatis fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes ad magnitudinem fluctuum tempestatumque accommodatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fluctibus consistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctibus compleri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantem Icariis fluctibus Africum Mercator metuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o navis, referent in mare te novi Fluctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulcere fluctus et tollere vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella ... fluctus ad sidera tollit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revomere salsos fluctus pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 182</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: excitare fluctus in simpulo, <hi rend="ital">to raise a tempest in a tea-pot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make much ado about nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18429.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a stream of odors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde fluens volvat varius se fluctus odorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 675</bibl></cit>.—And of <hi rend="ital">a stream of fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atro volvens incendia fluctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:572" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 572</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18429.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like tempestas and unda, and our waves or billows, for <hi rend="ital">turbulence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in hac tempestate populi jactemur et fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">contionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum Fluctibus in mediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc omne tempus post consulatum objecimus iis fluctibus, qui per nos a communi peste depulsi, in nosmet ipsos redundarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus civiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere irarum fluctus in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 298</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 831</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1290</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluens: <entryFree id="n18430" type="main" key="fluens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fluo.</entryFree>
fluenter: <entryFree id="n18431" type="main" key="flu^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a flowing manner</hi>, v. fluo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fluentia: <entryFree id="n18432" type="hapax" key="flu^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭentĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluency</hi> (trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluentisonus: <entryFree id="n18433" type="hapax" key="flu^enti^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭentĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluentum-sono</etym>, <sense id="n18433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wave-resounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluento: <entryFree id="n18434" type="main" key="flu^ento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fluentum</etym>, <sense id="n18434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to water</hi> (late Lat.), Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:642" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluentum: <entryFree id="n18435" type="main" key="flu^entum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">running water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">river.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18435.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose; usually in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">fluenta Lubrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:949" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 949</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xanthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauca (Cocyti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: cum inter fluenta tibiis fidibusque concineret, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by</hi> <cb n="FLUM" /> <hi rend="ital">the Euripus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jordanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 32</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 32.—Of <hi rend="ital">milk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonans (Juppiter) suxit fluenta mammarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18435.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stream of fire</hi> (cf. fluctus, II. A. 2.): flammarum, App. de Mundo, p. 73 (shortly before, flumina); <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi> or <hi rend="ital">current of air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 278</bibl>; al. fluenteis for fluentis.</sense></entryFree>
fluesco: <entryFree id="n18436" type="main" key="flu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭesco</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fluisco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [fluo], <hi rend="ital">to become fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi> (late Lat.): salem in aqua fluescere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fluibundus: <entryFree id="n18437" type="main" key="flu^i^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolving</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluibunda luxu puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fluido: <entryFree id="n18438" type="main" key="flu^i^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fluidus</etym>, <sense id="n18438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">liquore fluidantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluidus: <entryFree id="n18439" type="main" key="flu^i^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭĭdus</orth> (access. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭdus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:464" default="NO" valid="yes">464</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 4, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 24</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Caes.). </sense><sense id="n18439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam contrarium est quam terrenum fluido?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 482</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciam fluidos humano sanguine rictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18439.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18439.3" n="A" level="2"> In opposition to solid or firm, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxus, languidus): lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 231</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labor et aestus mollia et fluida Gallorum corpora decedere pugna coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 422" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 422</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18439.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 362</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluisco: <entryFree id="n18440" type="main" key="flu^isco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. fluesco.</entryFree>
fluito: <entryFree id="n18441" type="main" key="flu^i^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭĭto</orth> (contract. <orth extent="full" lang="la">flūto</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 77</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>), āvi, ātum, 1, <sense id="n18441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [fluo], <hi rend="ital">to float</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swim</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sail about</hi> on the water, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18441.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacu Apuscidamo omnia fluitant, nihil mergitur (shortly before: in quo stagno nihil innatet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 18, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies primo sidit, postea fluitare incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 7, 14, § 57</bibl></cit>: rei publicae navem fluitantem in alto tempestatibus, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitans alvĕus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitantes insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebenus in aquis non fluitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 35, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusile aurum per rictus,</quote> <trans><tr>to flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundum utrumque per jocum ludumque fluitantibus,</quote> <trans><tr>those who sail about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18441.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to move in a waving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsteady manner; to wave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitantia aplustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno fluitantia vela theatro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 17), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">vela summo fluitantia malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitantia lora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>slack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis non fluitans sed stricta et singulos artus exprimens,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitans labansque miles,</quote> <trans><tr>staggering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela (in theatris) per malos trabesque trementia flutant namque ... cogunt suo fluitare colore,</quote> <trans><tr>to wave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:77 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 77 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18441.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be doubtful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to waver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi incerto errore fluitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1052" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1052</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe dubiae horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde primum creditur Caecinae fides fluitasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitans fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra lectionis exemplum labor ille (scribendi) carens rectore fluitabit, i. e. will be performed at random,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flumen: <entryFree id="n18442" type="main" key="flu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing of water;</hi> and concr., <hi rend="ital">a flood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">running water</hi> (syn.: fluvius, amnis, rivus). </sense><sense id="n18442.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): Romane, aquam Albanam cave lacu contineri, cave in mare manare suo flumine sinas, an old prophetic formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus montano flumine torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 305</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visendus ater flumine languido Cocytos errans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde sequemur Ipsius amnis iter, donec nos flumine certo Perferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:189" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 189</bibl></cit>: et Tiberis flumen vomit in mare salsum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 453 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">teque pater Tiberine tuo cum flumine sancto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 55 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">donec me flumine vivo Abluero,</quote> <trans><tr>in a living</tr>, <tr>running stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 719</bibl></cit>; cf.: quin tu ante vivo perfunderis flumine? <cb n="FLUM" /> Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 6</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua viva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl></cit> Müll.).—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae venas et flumina fontis Elicuere sui,</quote> <trans><tr>streams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida Scamandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Symaethia circum Flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limosa potat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 634</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalus a labris sitiens fugientia captat Flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritima immittere in piscinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18442.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a river.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18442.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (the predominant signif. of the word both in prose and poetry): quod per amoenam urbem leni fluit agmine flumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 177 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut flumina in contrarias partes fluxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio biduum moratus ad flumen, quod inter eum et Domitii castra fluebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet non tantum venas aquarum terra, ex quibus corrivatis flumina effici possunt, sed et amnes magnitudinis vastae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullum hoc frigidius flumen attigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos flumina arcemus, dirigimus, avertimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una pars (Galliae) initium capit a flumine Rhodano, continetur Garumna flumine ... attingit etiam flumen Rhenum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter montem Juram et flumen Rhodanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen est Arar, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Dubis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Seres, non Tanain prope flumen orti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veliternos ad Asturae flumen Maenius fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 5</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum situs et flumina dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo flumine ad Lutetiam iter facere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>with the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. secundus, 2. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">magnum ire agmen adverso flumine,</quote> <trans><tr>against the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 60, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumine vicino stultus sitit, like,</quote> <trans><tr>starves in the midst of plenty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. p. 899</bibl></cit> Burm.—</sense><sense id="n18442.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things which flow in streams or like streams, <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 354</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1029" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1029</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">largoque humectat flumine vultum,</quote> <trans><tr>flood of tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta magis pressis manabunt flumina mammis,</quote> <trans><tr>streams of milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina jam lactis, jam flumina nectaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: rigido concussae flumine nubes Exonerabantur, <hi rend="ital">a torrent of rain</hi>, Petr. poët. Sat. 123; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut picis e caelo demissum flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>a stream of pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnesia flumine saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>in the magnetic stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1064</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusaeque ruunt inopino flumine turbae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a vast stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:185" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëris,</quote> <trans><tr>a current of air</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 61, 33</bibl></cit> Elm. p. 258 Bip.—</sense><sense id="n18442.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of expression, <hi rend="ital">a flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis flumine reprehensoris convicia diluuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen orationis aureum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen verborum volubili tasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimorum op timorumque verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanium verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysias ... puro fonti quam magno flumini propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:61" default="NO">9, 4, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—And fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque concipere neque edere partum mens potest, nisi ingenti flumine litterarum inundata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flumentana: <entryFree id="n18443" type="main" key="Flu_menta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flūmentāna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">porta</orth>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flumen</etym>, <sense id="n18443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate of Rome near the Tiber; River-gate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the entrance to the Campus Martius</hi>: Flumentana porta Romae appellata, quod Tiberis partem ea fluxisse affirmant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 21, 5</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. p. 254 ed. Marin.; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 155 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18443.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis cur, cum portam Flumentanam Caelius occuparit, ego Puteolos non meos faciam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a villa near the River-gate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flumicellum: <entryFree id="n18444" type="main" key="flu_mi^cellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūmĭcellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>flumen</etym>, <sense id="n18444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a streamlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rivulet</hi> (late Lat.), Innoc. de Cas. p. 227 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
fluminalis: <entryFree id="n18445" type="main" key="flu_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">river</hi>- (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancri,</quote> <trans><tr>river crawfish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:4:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flumineus: <entryFree id="n18446" type="main" key="flu_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">river</hi>- (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 599</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 565</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9</bibl></cit>, <pb n="763" /> <cb n="FLUO" /> 266: <cit><quote lang="la">alnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:458" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <trans><tr>used for crossing a river</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:494" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 494</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluo: <entryFree id="n18447" type="main" key="flu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype> (archaic form of the <sense id="n18447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: FLUCTUM, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 817</bibl> P.; cf.: fluo, fluctum, Not. Tir. From this form are derived fluctio and fluctus. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 800</bibl>, the correct read. is laveris, not flueris, v. Lachm. ad h. l.), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">flu-, flu=sai, a)naflu/w</foreign>, etc.; Lat. fleo, fletus; flumen, fluctus, etc.; orig. one root with fla-, to blow, q. v. and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 302" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 302</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> (cf.: mano, labor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: per amoenam urbem leni fluit agmine flumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 177 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut flumina in contrarias partes fluxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen quod inter eum et Domitii castra fluebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: aurea tum dicat per terras flumina vulgo Fluxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius Eurotas, qui propter Lacedaemonem fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetiorum inter fines et Allobrogum Rhodanus fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arar in utram partem fluat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae natura fluerent atque manarent, ut aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: fluens unda, <hi rend="ital">water from a stream</hi> (opp.: putealis unda, <hi rend="ital">spring-water</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foveam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 475</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxit in terram Remi cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit de corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 173</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor fluit undique rivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes rivis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudo sub pede musta fluunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidis fluit unda capillis,</quote> <trans><tr>drips</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum molle fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:435" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluunt lacrimae more perennis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:820" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluens nausea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus fluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit ignibus aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes fluid</tr>, <tr>melts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 251</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18447.3" n="1" level="3"> Of bodies, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi> with any fluid.— With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fluvius Atratus sanguine fluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruore fluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:343" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudore fluentia brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluunt sudore et lassitudine membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui fluit unguine tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:360" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilisque rubenti Fluxit mulctra mero,</quote> <trans><tr>overflows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:190" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 190</bibl></cit>. —Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidāque fluens in veste Menoetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluentes cerussataeque buccae,</quote> <trans><tr>dripping with paint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266, 2</bibl>. b. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeculae vites acinorum exiguitate minus fluunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>yield but little wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:5" default="NO">3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:1" default="NO">12, 52, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of kin. signif.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oenotria vina fluens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 264</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.4" n="2" level="3"> To move in the manner of fluids, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde alium (aëra) supra fluere,</quote> <trans><tr>to flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 514</bibl></cit> and 522: <cit><quote lang="la">unde fluens volvat varius se fluctus odorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:675 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 675 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principio omnibus a rebus, quascumque videmus, Perpetuo fluere ac mitti spargique necesse est Corpora, quae feriant oculos visumque lacessant: Perpetuoque fluunt certis ab rebus odores, Frigus ut a fluviis, calor a sole, aestus ab undis Aequoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:922 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 922 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus e lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1002" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1002</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit undique victor Mulciber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae per levia colla fluentes,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiaeque fluant per mea colla rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 72: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis fluens,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicisque fluentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodoque sinus collecta fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 320</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: balteus nec strangulet nec fluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mersa est pelago, nec fluit ulla ratis,</quote> <trans><tr>floats</tr>, <tr>is tossed about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:66:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 66, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos compesce fluentes,</quote> <trans><tr>floating around</tr>, <tr>spreading out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram fluit devexo pondere cervix,</quote> <trans><tr>droops</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnisque relictis Turba fluit castris,</quote> <trans><tr>pour forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli fluunt ad regia tecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 236</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a multitude or crowd of men: densatis ordinibus effuse fluentem in se aciem excepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.5" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., of bodies, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excident gladii, fluent arma de manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli fluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte fluent (poma) matura suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi longinquo fluere omnia cernimus aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta fluunt omnisque vagans formatur imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 178</bibl></cit>: dissolvuntur enim tum demum membra <cb n="FLUO" /> fluuntque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 919</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surae fluxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccae fluentes,</quote> <trans><tr>fallen in</tr>, <tr>lank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18447.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18447.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come forth;
