to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ejus (Nestoris) lingua melle dulcior fluebat oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen vena pauperiore fluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calidii oratio ita libere fluebat, ut nusquam adhaeresceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Herodoto omnia leniter fluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: grammatice pleno jam satis alveo fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae totis viribus fluit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio ferri debet ac fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 112</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the writer himself: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (Herodotus) sine ullis salebris quasi sedatus amnis fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucilius) cum flueret lutulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ab ea (luna) manant et fluunt, quibus animantes alantur augescantque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia ex eodem fonte fluxerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi facultatem ex intimis sapientiae fontibus fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19" default="NO">5, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:14" default="NO">5, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ex natura rerum hominumque fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ex Graeco fluxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab isto capite fluere necesse est omnem rationem bonorum et malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde id quoque vitium fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:33" default="NO">7, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorae doctrina cum longe lateque flueret,</quote> <trans><tr>spread itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum fluxisse video de libris nostris variumque sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mihi tarda fluunt ingrataque tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>flow</tr>, <tr>pass</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus prosperis et ad voluntatem nostram fluentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>going</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: rebus supra votum fluentibus, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 169</bibl> (Hist. 1, 101 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus prospere fluentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>succeeding</tr>, <tr>prospering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl>: illius rationes quorsum fluant, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, Attic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res fluit ad interregnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta in Mithridatem fluxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18447.9" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, etc., <hi rend="ital">to flow uniformly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be monotonous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiendum est ne fluat oratio, ne vagetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod species ipsa carminum docet, non impetu et instinctu nec ore uno fluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79</bibl>.—Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (voluptate) cum liquescimus fluimusque mollitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluens mollitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO">2, 88, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera nasci, occidere, fluere, labi, nec diutius esse uno et eodem statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit voluptas corporis et prima quaeque avolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluentem procumbentemque rem publicam populi Romani restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18447.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fluens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18447.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debauched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde soluti ac fluentes non accipiunt e scholis mala ista, sed in scholas afferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campani fluentes luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessu ipso ultra muliebrem mollitiem fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluentibus membris, incessu femineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 7:26" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.12" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, </sense><sense id="n18447.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed in his tracta quaedam et fluens expetitur, non haec contorta et acris oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et fluens contextus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne immoderata aut angusta aut dissoluta aut fluens sit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipata et inculta et fluens oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65, 220</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. of the speaker: in locis ac descriptionibus fusi ac fluentes sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waving manner</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">res quaeque fluenter fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 935</bibl></cit> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 520</bibl>, where the correct read. is cientur; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Lachm.): capillo fluenter undante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18447.15" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18447.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa arida atque fluxa, App. de Mundo: sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas fluxum pertusumque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>leaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa crine fluxo thyrsum quatiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 362</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cingeretur fluxiore cinctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa arma,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging slack</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.18" n="(b)" level="5"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">frail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spadone eviratior fluxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FLUV" /> 41, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">(murorum) aevo fluxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18447.19" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18447.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi molles et aetate fluxi dolis haud difficulter capiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi fluxioris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces noctu dieque fluxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum non enerve nec fluxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa atque aperta securitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18447.21" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">frail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res nostrae ut in secundis fluxae, ut in adversis bonae,</quote> <trans><tr>decayed</tr>, <tr>impaired</tr>, <tr>disordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: hujus belli fortuna, ut in secundis, fluxa; <cit><quote lang="la">ut in adversis, bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res humanae fluxae et mobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum et formae gloria fluxa atque fragilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">instabile et fluxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave fidem fluxam geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 50, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa et vana fides,</quote> <trans><tr>unreliable</tr>, <tr>unstable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia inania et fluxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxa senio mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">remissly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">more vitae remissioris fluxius agens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluonia: <entryFree id="n18448" type="main" key="Flu^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flŭōnĭa</orth> (coll. forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flŭvĭōnĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 30</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flŭvōnĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Juno</hi>, so called: quod eam sanguinis fluorem in conceptu retinere putabant, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 7:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 7, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 118</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fluor: <entryFree id="n18449" type="main" key="flu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n18449.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua natura res labilis et ad fluorem semper tam prona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 18</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluores amnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 348, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis fluores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelligimus omnes ventos aëris esse fluorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines jugi fluore a corporibus manantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18449.2" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diarrœa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluore aeger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutio et fluor stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 108" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flustra: <entryFree id="n18450" type="main" key="flustra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flustra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the usual quiet state of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a calm</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">flustra, motus maris sine tempestate fluctuantis. Naevius in bello Poenico quod ait: honorariae honestae stabant in flustris, ut si diceret in salo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Fragm. p. 425</bibl></cit> ed. Bip. (reprinted ap. Müll. Fest. pp. 89, 382); cf.: flustra dicuntur, cum in mari fluctus non moventur, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">malaki/an</foreign> vocant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare de nustris temperatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluta: <entryFree id="n18451" type="main" key="flu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">plwth/</foreign>, the floater</etym>, <sense id="n18451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of large muraena</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluto: <entryFree id="n18452" type="main" key="flu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. fluito.</entryFree>
fluvia: <entryFree id="n18453" type="main" key="flu^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. fluvius <sense id="n18453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fluvialis: <entryFree id="n18454" type="main" key="flu^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluvius</etym>, <sense id="n18454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">river</hi>-, <hi rend="ital">fluvial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; v. lupus.</sense></entryFree>
fluviaticus: <entryFree id="n18455" type="main" key="flu^vi^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a river</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluviatilis: <entryFree id="n18456" type="main" key="flu^vi^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">river</hi>- (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluviatus: <entryFree id="n18457" type="hapax" key="flu^vi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soaked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steeped in a river</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fluvidus: <entryFree id="n18458" type="main" key="flu_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flūvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. fluidus.</entryFree>
fluvionia: <entryFree id="n18459" type="main" key="Flu^vi^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flŭvĭōnĭa</orth>, v. Fluonia.</entryFree>
fluvius: <entryFree id="n18460" type="main" key="flu^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flŭvĭus</orth> (in inscrr. also written FLOVIOS), ii (<sense id="n18460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:391" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 391</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">flūviōrum scanned as a trisyllable,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 482</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> (access. form <itype>fluvia, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 7 sq.</bibl>) [fluo], <hi rend="ital">a river.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; but much less freq. than flumen; not in Caes., who employs flumen several hundred times): postquam consistit fluvius, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. de Orat. p. 129" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. de Orat. p. 129</bibl> ed. Nieb. (Ann. v. 68 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fluvio aquam derivare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Hypanim fluvium, qui ab Europae parte in Pontum influit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurotas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sagra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 7</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Albim fluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fluvio dea condidit alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvio succedit opaco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium vinclis innaret Cloelia ruptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvio cum forte secundo Deflueret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 494</bibl></cit>: nec fluvii <pb n="764" /> <cb n="FOCU" /> strepunt hibernā nive turgidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Styx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 384</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">415</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 749</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam istic fluvius est, quem non recipiat mare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18460.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., like flumen, for <hi rend="ital">running water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stream</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">arbuta sufficere et fluvios praebere recentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 301</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatura malum fluvio vivente soporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:574" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusa certo fluvio terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluxe: <entryFree id="n18461" type="main" key="fluxe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>fluo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. <sense id="n18461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fluxilis: <entryFree id="n18462" type="main" key="fluxi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluxus, fr. fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fluid</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fusile et fluxile liquoris est qualitas,</quote> <trans><tr>fluidity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluxio: <entryFree id="n18463" type="main" key="fluxi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fluo</etym>, false reading for eluvio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl>; <sense id="n18463.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and for fluctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 119, § 183</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
fluxipedus: <entryFree id="n18464" type="hapax" key="fluxi^pe^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxĭpĕdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluo-pes</etym>, <sense id="n18464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing down to the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluxuosus: <entryFree id="n18465" type="main" key="fluxu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluxus</etym>, <sense id="n18465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>: venarum rivuli, Ven. et Germ. 45.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter fluxuosas hujus mundi felicitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fluxura: <entryFree id="n18466" type="main" key="fluxu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n18466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi> (postAug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl> and 32.</sense></entryFree>
fluxus: <entryFree id="n18467" type="main" key="fluxus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>fluo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18468" type="main" key="fluxus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fluxus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flux</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis, Justin. 12, 9, 12: (echenēis piscis) fluxus gravidarum utero sistens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus non aliud intelligitur quam fluxus aëris,</quote> <trans><tr>a current of air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandrico fluxu delicatam vestem humi protrahere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>folds</tr>, <tr>drapery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl> the correct read. is flexu, v. 2. flexus, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
focacius: <entryFree id="n18469" type="hapax" key="fo^ca_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcācĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>focus</etym>, <sense id="n18469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hearth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearth-</hi>: panis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">baked on the hearth</hi> (in the ashes), <hi rend="ital">ash-cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
focale: <entryFree id="n18470" type="main" key="fo_ca_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōcāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for faucale from fauces</etym>, <sense id="n18470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neck-cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cravat</hi>, worn by sick or effeminate persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:142" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
focaneus: <entryFree id="n18471" type="main" key="fo_ca_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōcānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for faucaneus from fauces</etym>, <sense id="n18471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a throat</hi>: palmes, <hi rend="ital">a branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprout growing between two other sprouts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:35" default="NO">5, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
focarius: <entryFree id="n18472" type="main" key="fo^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>focus</etym>, <sense id="n18472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kitchen-boy; a kitchen-maid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cook.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO">33, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 8, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">focaria,</quote> <trans><tr>a housekeeper</tr>, <tr>concubine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2671 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
focatius: <entryFree id="n18473" type="main" key="fo^ca_tius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcātius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. focacius.</entryFree>
focillationes: <entryFree id="n18474" type="gloss" key="focillationes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">focillationes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">focilat-</orth>), <itype>foculi, a fovendo, id est calefaciendo, dicta sunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
focillo: <entryFree id="n18475" type="main" key="fo^cillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcillo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fŏcĭlo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcillor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>focus</etym>, <sense id="n18475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to revive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi> by warmth, <hi rend="ital">to resuscitate</hi> one who is faint or nearly dead: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse paucis diebus aegre focilatus decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18475.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cherish</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pudet me sic tecum loqui et tam levibus remediis te focillare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">deponent</hi> form: suum quisque diversi commodum focillantur, <hi rend="ital">foster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
focula: <entryFree id="n18476" type="main" key="fo^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. foculus <sense id="n18476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
foculare: <entryFree id="n18477" type="main" key="fo^cu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>foculus</etym>, <sense id="n18477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hearth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire-place</hi>: coctura in focularibus praeparata, Aldhelm. Laud. Virg. 38.</sense></entryFree>
foculo: <entryFree id="n18478" type="gloss" key="fo^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, i. q. fovere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 10, 1</bibl> (contr. from foviculo).</entryFree>
foculus: <entryFree id="n18479" type="main" key="fo^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (in <number>plur.</number> also heterocl. <itype>focula, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 24</bibl>) <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>focus</etym>, <sense id="n18479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hearth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fire-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafing-dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brazier.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18479.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrepto carbone exstincto e foculo imaginem in pariete delineavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas foveri foculis ferventibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram accenso ad sacrificium foculo inicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 6" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 6</bibl> ed. Mai.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">jam intus ventris fumant foculo, Calefieri jussi reliquias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18479.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucca foculum excitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:262" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 262</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
focus: <entryFree id="n18480" type="main" key="fo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root bha-, to be bright, Gr. <cb n="FODI" /> <foreign lang="greek">fa</foreign>- (cf. for, fari), strengthened, fac-, fax, facies, etc., Corss. Ausspr. 1, 423, who refers even facio to this root</etym>. <sense id="n18480.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fire-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearth</hi> (syn.: clibanus, furnus, fornax, caminus): Varro focos ait dictos, quod foveat ignes, nam ignis ipsa flamma est: quicquid autem ignem fovet, focus vocatur, seu ara sit seu quid aliud, in quo ignis fovetur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at focus a flammis, et quod fovet omnia, dictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:301" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 301</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum meus assiduo luceat igne focus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum splendet focus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna super foco Large reponens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio ad focum sedenti magnum auri pondus Samnites, cum attulissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 16, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 522, 28</bibl> (Rep. 3, 28 ed. Mos.); <cit><quote lang="la">68, 17: ad focum angues nundinari solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstruere lignis focum,</quote> <trans><tr>to pile on wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of a <hi rend="ital">funeral-pile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 212</bibl>; of an <hi rend="ital">altar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19</bibl> (3, 12), 14; 4, 5, 64 (5, 5, 66 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:753 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 753 al.</bibl>—On the hearths of Roman houses were placed, in little niches, the household gods (Lares), and for them a fire was kept up: <cit><quote lang="la">haec imponentur in foco nostro Lari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">focus Larium, quo familia convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 20, 81, § 267</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18480.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: focus, like our <hi rend="ital">hearth</hi>, serves to denote the <hi rend="ital">house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">family</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi focique fac vicissim ut memineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum ejicit domo atque focis patriis disque penatibus praecipitem Sextum exturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agellus, quem tu fastidis, habitatum quinque focis,</quote> <trans><tr>by five houses</tr>, <tr>families</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: arae et foci, pro aris et focis pugnare, to signify one's dearest possessions; v. ara. —</sense><sense id="n18480.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fire-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coal-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brazier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem in foco caldo sub testu coquito leniter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">76, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fodico: <entryFree id="n18481" type="main" key="fo^di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏdĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n18481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fodio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pierce</hi> (rare but class.). * </sense><sense id="n18481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mercemur servum, qui dictet nomina, laevum Qui fodicet latus et cogat dextram Porrigere, <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jog in the side</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 51</bibl> (for which fodit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 17</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">lateribus fodicatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, p. 98</bibl></cit> Bip.—</sense><sense id="n18481.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum fodicant, bona distimulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: cf.: stimulus ego nunc sum tibi; <cit><quote lang="la">fodico corculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est in nostra potestate fodicantibus iis rebus, quas malas esse opinemur, dissimulatio vel oblivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fodina: <entryFree id="n18482" type="main" key="fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.; a place from which a mineral is dug</etym>, <sense id="n18482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl> (also written in one word argentifodina, v. h. v.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:3 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 9, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fodio: <entryFree id="n18483" type="main" key="fo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype> (ante-class. form of the <sense id="n18483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. praes. pass.</hi> fodiri, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 35</bibl>, but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 21</bibl>, where the correct read. is exfodivi.— Also acc. to the first conj.: Illyrii restant sicis sibinisque fodantes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll.; cf.: fodare fodere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84, 7</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. root badh-, to dig, ava-bādha, dug out; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ba/qos, baqu/s, be/nqos, a)/bussos</foreign>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">bo/qros</foreign>, pit; hence, fossa, fundus (for fudnus); cf. Anglo-Sax. bodom; Engl. bottom; Germ. Boden, etc.; cf. Fick, Vergl. Wörterb. p. 131; Grimm, Deutsch. Wörterb. s. v. Boden], <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig out</hi> (class.).—</sense><sense id="n18483.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam domum revertor, quin te in fundo conspicer Fodere aut arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: fodit; <cit><quote lang="la">invenit auri aliquantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas novellas fodere aut arare et postea occare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hortum fodiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <trans><tr>to undermine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 535</bibl></cit>; but, vallum, <hi rend="ital">to dig out the earth</hi> needed for it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum ferramentis,</quote> <trans><tr>to dig</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puteos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes, trium in altitudinem pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia (talpae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum etiam incolae fodiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gypsum e terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram gramineam de cespite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 391</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18483.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi>, <cb n="FOED" /> <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stab</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">at ego te pendentem fodiam stimulis triginta dies,</quote> <trans><tr>to prick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non latus fodi (cultro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equi armos calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 881</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttura cultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversos (elephantos) sub caudis, qua maxime molli cute vulnera accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos pugionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmatam levi gladio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa ora resistentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Dic jussisse te. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Noli fodere: <cit><quote lang="la">jussi,</quote> <trans><tr>don't punch me in the side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit> (cf. fodicare).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausonius mersis celer fodit aequora remis,</quote> <trans><tr>digs through</tr>, <tr>ploughs through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:359" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas (ungula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:456" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 456</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:102" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18483.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to goad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num exspectas, dum te stimulis fodiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cor stimulo foditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pungit dolor, vel fodiat sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus in iras,</quote> <trans><tr>to excite</tr>, <tr>stir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:159" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fodo: <entryFree id="n18484" type="main" key="fo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. fodio <sense id="n18484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
foecunde: <entryFree id="n18485" type="main" key="foecunde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foecunde</orth>, <itype>foecunditas, foecundo, foecundus</itype>, v. fec-.</entryFree>
foede: <entryFree id="n18486" type="main" key="foede_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. foedus <sense id="n18486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
foederaticus: <entryFree id="n18487" type="main" key="foede^ra_ticus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedĕrāticus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. foedus</etym>, <sense id="n18487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a league</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the allied</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 147:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 147, 2</bibl>, and 148, 2.</sense></entryFree>
foedero: <entryFree id="n18488" type="main" key="foede^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. foedus</etym>, <sense id="n18488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to establish by treaty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">league</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi>, late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum foederaretur concordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; but class. in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">foedĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">leagued together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui foederatis civitatibus ascripti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 22</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium beneficiorum nostrorum expertes faciat foederatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertinorum foederatum atque pacatum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foedifragus: <entryFree id="n18489" type="main" key="foedi^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. foedus + frango</etym>, <sense id="n18489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">league-breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfidious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Poeni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. Mos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:Fragm. 2, p. 513 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. Fragm. 2, p. 513 sq.</bibl>; so, hostes, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 912</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foeditas: <entryFree id="n18490" type="main" key="foedi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. foedus</etym>, <sense id="n18490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horridness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18490.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">multae beluae insectantes odoris intolerabili foeditate depellunt,</quote> <trans><tr>stench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditas, qua Sulla obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 33, 39, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditates cicatricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hipponacti notabilis foeditas vultus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus scelere in hac vestitus foeditate fuerimus (viz. in a military cloak),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertere omnes a tanta foeditate spectaculi (i. e. Mettii quadrigis discerpti) oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18490.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">si turpitudo in deformitate corporis habet aliquid offensionis, quanta illa depravatio et foeditas turpificati animi debet videri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditate sua turpitudo ipsa deterret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima barbarismi ac soloecismi foeditas absit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO">12, 10, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foedo: <entryFree id="n18491" type="main" key="foedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideous; to defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfigure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deform</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18491.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyiae contactu omnia foedant immundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedare in pulvere crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem vultusque seniles pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes sanguine per aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 723</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem calido sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pugnis, unguibus ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: ferro foedati jacent, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 241</bibl> (Trag. v. 442 ed. Vahl.); cf.: foedant et proterunt hostium copias, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mutilate with wounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me (i. e. Prometheum) perenni vivum foedat miseria, Cic. Poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 24: obscenas pelagi ferro foedare volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedati agri, terror injectus urbi est,</quote> <trans><tr>laid waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla tectoria eorum rimae foedavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl></cit>: nubes foedavere lumen, Sall. Fragm. ap. Serv <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 286</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aër assiduo noctem foedaverat imbre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 538</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18491.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sully</hi>: <pb n="765" /> <cb n="FOED" /> (Graeci) nos quoque dictitant barbaros et spurcius nos quam alios opicos appellatione foedant, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedati crimine turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam ipsam foedavit adventus tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vestis serica viros foedaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procerum conubiis mixtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra pollui foedarique a Classico ne sinatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregia erga populum Romanum merita mox rebelles foedarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedata per avaritiam victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplici clade foedatus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foedus: <entryFree id="n18492" type="main" key="foedus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dhūmas, smoke; cf.: fumus, fīmus, feteo</etym>, <sense id="n18492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi> (class.; cf.: deformis, turpis). </sense><sense id="n18492.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">cimices foedissimum animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba odoris foedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 16, 63, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc eo tibi videtur foedus, quia illam (vestem) non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanissimum et foedissimum monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda fit volucris (sc. bubo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput impexa foedum porrigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda nigro simulacra fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum recentibus vestigiis vulnerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca tetra, inculta, foeda, formidolosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedissima tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 47, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia foeda homini, foeda pecori,</quote> <trans><tr>destructive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedum relatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 167</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">foediora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18492.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (tyranno) neque tetrius, neque foedius, nec diis hominibusque invisius animal ullum cogitari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fieri potest miserius, nihil perditius, nihil foedius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria senectuti foedissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptores carmine foedo Splendida facta linunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 236</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedissima ludibria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum foedissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus interitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus et perniciosus exitus judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministeria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:723" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprobratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsequentia rerum foedissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: ludos vero non facere, quid foedius? (shortly before: quid turpius?) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versum in oratione fieri multo foedissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">foede</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horribly</hi>: foede divexarier, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 84 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">aram turparunt sanguine foede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foede aliquem distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laniare crura brachiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesa manus juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob admissum foede dictumve superbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: perire <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedius inde pulsus quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa agetur foedissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18493" type="main" key="foedus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foedus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (for foedus, Ennius wrote fidus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 86</bibl> Müll. Archaic form of the <sense id="n18493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> foedesum, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.
