L. 7, § 27</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">R</ref></xr>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from the root FID; Sanscr. bandh, ligare; v. fido</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a league</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi> (cf.: sponsio, pactio). </sense><sense id="n18493.1" n="I" level="1"> Polit.: <cit><quote lang="la">FOEDERVM, PACIS, BELLI, INDVCIARVM ORATORES FETIALES IVDICESVE SVNTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse autem tria genera foederum, quibus inter se paciscerentur amicitias civitates regesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 57, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem foedusque facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratrices pacis et foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorigem sibi societate et foedere adjungunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne societates, ne foedera nova acciperemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem foedere confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:35:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (foederibus) etiam cum hoste devincitur fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam et foedus petere, Sall J. 104, 4: foedus facere cum aliquibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 30</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FOLI" /> 91; so, <cit><quote lang="la">foedus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 9 al.</bibl>: ferire, icere, pangere, percutere, v. h. vv.: de foedere decedere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera negligere, violare, rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum nominisque Latini jura negligere ac foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra foedus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus aequum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 9</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequo venire in amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedere iniquo alligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 46, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex foedere,</quote> <trans><tr>according to agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 39, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the polit. sphere, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus fecerunt cum tribuno plebis palam, ut ab eo provincias acciperent, quas ipsi vellent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorum turpissimorum foedera ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalami,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>marriage contract</tr>, <tr>marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 403</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communia studii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18493.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">a law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo has leges aeternaque foedera certis Inposuit natura locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Foedere naturae certo discrimina servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:924" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 924</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:906" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 906</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedere certo et premere et laxas dare habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve potentis naturae pollue foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 353</bibl></cit>: caeli foedera, Col. Poët. 10, 219.</sense></entryFree>
foen: <entryFree id="n18494" type="main" key="foen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foen</orth>, v. fen.</entryFree>
foeteo: <entryFree id="n18495" type="main" key="foete^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetĕo</orth>, v. feteo.</entryFree>
foetesco: <entryFree id="n18496" type="main" key="foetesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetesco</orth>, v. fetesco.</entryFree>
foetidus: <entryFree id="n18497" type="main" key="foeti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetĭdus</orth>, v. fetidus.</entryFree>
foetor: <entryFree id="n18498" type="main" key="foetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetor</orth>, v. fetor.</entryFree>
foetulentus: <entryFree id="n18499" type="main" key="foetu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetŭlentus</orth>, v. fetulentus.</entryFree>
foetus: <entryFree id="n18500" type="main" key="foetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetus</orth>, v. fetus.</entryFree>
foetutina: <entryFree id="n18501" type="main" key="foetu_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">foetūtīna</orth>, v. fetutina.</entryFree>
folia: <entryFree id="n18502" type="main" key="Fo_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fōlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a witch of Ariminum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:42" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foliaceus: <entryFree id="n18503" type="main" key="fo^li^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>folium</etym>, <sense id="n18503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like leaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 7, 36, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foliatilis: <entryFree id="n18504" type="main" key="fo^li^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>foliatus</etym>, <sense id="n18504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leafy</hi> (late Lat.): umbra, Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:535" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foliatura: <entryFree id="n18505" type="main" key="fo^li^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaf-work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foliage</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cupresseae foliaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foliatus: <entryFree id="n18506" type="main" key="fo^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>folium</etym>, <sense id="n18506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leafy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18506.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 59, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18506.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. unguentum), <hi rend="ital">an ointment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oil made of the leaves of spikenard</hi> (hence also called nardinum), <hi rend="ital">nard-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:465" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:110:2" default="NO">14, 110, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foliosus: <entryFree id="n18507" type="main" key="fo^li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leafy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of leaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aizoum foliosum usque ad cacumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor foliosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 23, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
folium: <entryFree id="n18508" type="main" key="fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fu/llon</foreign>, for <foreign lang="greek">fulion</foreign>; cf. alius, <foreign lang="greek">a)/llos</foreign>; root prob. <foreign lang="greek">fla-, flasmo/s</foreign>; Lat. flos, Flora</etym>, <sense id="n18508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaf</hi> (cf. frons). </sense><sense id="n18508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in arboribus? in quibus non truncus, non rami, non folia sunt denique, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissima (folia) fico, angusta myrto, capillata pino, aculeata aquifolio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concava caepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis ex arboribus strictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida laureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: folia nunc cadunt, si triduom hoc hic erimus, tum arbores in te cadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—As a proverb of mobility or changeableness: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me consules movent, qui ipsi pluma aut folio facilius moventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—The Sibyl wrote her oracles on leaves (acc. to Varro, on palmleaves), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 444</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 74</bibl> Serv.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, prov.: credite me vobis folium recitare Sibyllae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I am talking gospel</tr>, <tr>absolute truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 126</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18508.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thing of no consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia sunt artis et nugae merae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18508.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leaf of paper</hi> (late Lat. for plagula, charta, or schedula): <cit><quote lang="la">ille manu retractis in calcem foliis sic exorsus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 29, § 103</bibl>, <cb n="FOME" /> the better read. is fila; v. Jan. and Sillig, ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
folleatus: <entryFree id="n18509" type="hapax" key="folle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>follis</etym>, <sense id="n18509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">expanding and contracting like a pair of bellows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingulati calcei sunt, quos nos folleatos vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. follicans, in follico.</sense></entryFree>
folleo: <entryFree id="n18510" type="main" key="folle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puff out like bellows</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">si pes laxa pelle non folleat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
follico: <entryFree id="n18511" type="main" key="folli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n18511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to expand and contract one's self like a pair of bellows</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia follicent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 75, 1</bibl></cit>.—Usu. in the <hi rend="ital">part. praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muli senes ... follicantes nares languidas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon oscitans vescitur, follicans ruminat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxae manicae, caligae follicantes,</quote> <trans><tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
folliculare: <entryFree id="n18512" type="gloss" key="folli^cu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĭcŭlāre</orth> <itype>appellatur pars remi, quae folliculo est tecta, a quo vita follicularis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll. (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/skwma</foreign>).</entryFree>
folliculosus: <entryFree id="n18513" type="main" key="folli^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>folliculus</etym>, <sense id="n18513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of husks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
folliculus: <entryFree id="n18514" type="main" key="folli^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>follis</etym>, <sense id="n18514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sack.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18514.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18514.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">folliculis frumentum vehere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam judicatus est parentem occidisse: ei statim ... os obvolutum est folliculo et praeligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>.—Of a matricide: <cit><quote lang="la">statim folliculo lupino os obvolutum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18514.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. (cf. follis, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">a ball to play with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflated with air; a wind-ball</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pila, globus, sphaera): post bella civilia ad pilam, folliculumque transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18514.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18514.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a husk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follicle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latentem frugem ruptis velamentis suis, quae folliculos agricolae vocant, adaperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gluma est grani folliculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spica se exserit folliculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 124:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 124, 11</bibl></cit>. —So of fruits, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 33, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folliculus animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 12, 37, § 111</bibl></cit>: muliebris, i. q. vulva, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 136</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the shell of an egg</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teretes (cicadarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 803</bibl></cit>; and of the human body, as the husk or shell of the soul: ego, si qui sum et quo folliculo sum indutus, queo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18514.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., as med. t. t. (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n18514.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:154" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18514.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bladder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:24" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18514.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The scrotum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:165" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 106</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called in full, folliculum genitale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:8:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
folligena: <entryFree id="n18515" type="hapax" key="folli^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>follis-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n18515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">produced by a bellows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>: bombi, Poët. in Anth. Lat. II. p. 64 Wernsd. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
follis: <entryFree id="n18516" type="main" key="follis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. flo</etym>. <sense id="n18516.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18516.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pair of bellows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae, quas vos effici sine follibus et sine incudibus non putatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">folle fabrili flando accenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 449</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18516.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A playing-ball inflated with wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a windball</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te follem pugillatorium faciam, et pendentem incursabo pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folle decet pueros ludere, folle senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:47:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:5" default="NO">4, 19, 5</bibl>; cf. folliculus, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n18516.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leathern money-bag</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tenso folle reverti Inde domum possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:281" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 281</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:82" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18516.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small piece of money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum folles aeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquaginta folles petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 22:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 22, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Crescent. 3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Crescent. 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18516.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cushion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pillow inflated with air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wind-cushion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18516.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the stomach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devorata in follem ventris recondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">puffed cheeks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc immensa cavi spirant (causidici) mendacia folles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
follitim: <entryFree id="n18517" type="hapax" key="folli_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">follītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>follis, I. C.</etym>, <sense id="n18517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by the purseful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil moror vetera et vulgata verba, Peratim ductare: at ego follitim ductitabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will cheat of his money by the purseful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
folus: <entryFree id="n18518" type="gloss" key="fo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏlus</orth>, v. olus <sense id="n18518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fomentatio: <entryFree id="n18519" type="main" key="fo_menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōmentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fomento</etym>, <sense id="n18519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fomentation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fomentationis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fomento: <entryFree id="n18520" type="main" key="fo_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fomentum</etym>, <sense id="n18520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 8</bibl>. <pb n="766" /> <cb n="FONS" /></sense></entryFree>
fomentum: <entryFree id="n18521" type="main" key="fo_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from fovimentum from foveo</etym>, <sense id="n18521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warm application</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warm lotion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poultice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fomentation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calida, sicca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assideat, fomenta paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juvant) fomenta podagrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: fomenta vulneribus nulla, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bandages</hi> (before, ligamenta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18521.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for fomes, <hi rend="ital">touch-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindling-wood</hi>: se ex arboribus fomenta excidisse, Clod. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fomenta ignium varia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18521.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18521.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lenitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt solatia, haec fomenta summorum dolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patentiae, fortitudinis fomentis dolor mitigari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaribus animis adhibenda fomenta, ut ferre pacem velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertati suae fomenta conquirere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec ingrata ventis dividat Fomenta, vulnus nil malum levantia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>consolations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18521.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi frigida curarum fomenta relinquere posses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fomes: <entryFree id="n18522" type="main" key="fo_mes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōmes</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>foveo</etym>, <sense id="n18522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kindling-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18522.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silici scintillam excudit Achates . . . rapuitque in fomite flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 776</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18522.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">fomes et incitabulum ingenii virtutisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 942</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18522.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: fomites sunt assulae ex arboribus, dum caeduntur, excussae: dictae, quod in eo opere occupati cibis potuque confoventur, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.; cf.: Fomes <foreign lang="greek">pele/khma</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</sense></entryFree>
fomito: <entryFree id="n18523" type="gloss" key="fomito"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fomito</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">pelekw=</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
fons: <entryFree id="n18524" type="main" key="fons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fons</orth>, <itype>fontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xe/vw, xeu/sw</foreign>, to pour, <foreign lang="greek">xu/ma, xoh/</foreign>, etc.; Lat. fundo, futtilis. Fons, i. e. stem font, for fovont = <foreign lang="greek">xevont</foreign>-; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl> Müll.; and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n18524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-source</hi> (syn.: scaturigo, puteus). </sense><sense id="n18524.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">late parvus aquaï Prata riget fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons dulcis aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 890</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons aquae dulcis, cui nomen Arethusa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivorum a fonte deductio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est apud Hammonis fanum fons luce diurna Frigidus, et calidus nocturno tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:848 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 848 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 873</bibl>: eunt ad fontem, nitidant (i. e. abluunt) corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 16</bibl> (Trag. v. 166 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 49, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) locum delegit fontibus abundantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium qui celat origines, Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes Alandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padi fons diebus aestivis aret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 102, 105, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestris amicum fontibus et choris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: fas pervicaces est mihi Thyiadas Vinique fontem lactis et uberes Cantare rivos, <hi rend="ital">the fountains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">streams of wine drawn from the earth by the stroke of the thyrsus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tui fontes vel inimicis tuis pateant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18524.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n18524.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mineral spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healing waters</hi>, = aquae, frigidi medicatique fontes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et stomachum supponere fontibus Clusinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons calidus medicae salubritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 16, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicatorum fontium vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18524.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spring-water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum fontine an Libero imperium te inhibere mavis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii fontemque ignemque ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 337</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18524.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fountain-head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meos amicos...ad Graecos ire jubeo, ut ea a fontibus potius potius hauriant, quam rivulos consectentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. rivuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons maledicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic fons, hoc principium est movendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi recte sapere est et principium et fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 309</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilicia origo et fons belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illo fonte et capite Socrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (philosophorum) fons ipse Socrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui rerum caput hoc erat et fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum partus atque fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia ex eodem fonte fluxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: omnes omnium rerum, quae ad dicendum pertinerent, fontes animo ac memoria <cb n="FOR" /> continere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae fontes aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos eloquentiae aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi facultatem ex intimis sapientiae fontibus fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes ut adire remotos Atque haurire queam vitae praecepta beate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis fontibus unde omnia ornamenta dicendi sumuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa atque fons maeroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia, qui est amicitiae fons a natura constitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is fons mali hujusce fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons vitii et perjurii,</quote> <trans><tr>thou source of all iniquity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18524.6" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fons</orth>, personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, with a chapel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fontana: <entryFree id="n18525" type="main" key="fonta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fontanus, II.</entryFree>
fontanalis: <entryFree id="n18526" type="main" key="Fonta_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fontānālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Fontinalis.</entryFree>
fontaneus: <entryFree id="n18527" type="main" key="fonta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fons</etym>, <sense id="n18527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the fountain-head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaturigo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defluvia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fontanus: <entryFree id="n18528" type="main" key="fonta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>-. </sense><sense id="n18528.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:269" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 269</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18528.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, in late Lat.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fontāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi>, Innocent. de Cas. p. 245 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
fonteius: <entryFree id="n18529" type="main" key="Fonte_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fontēĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So M. Fonteius, <hi rend="ital">a praetor in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in defence of whom Cicero delivered the oration still preserved in part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl>. His sister Fonteia, <hi rend="ital">a vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 37</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Fontēĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fonteius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. 27, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fonticola: <entryFree id="n18530" type="hapax" key="fonti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fons-colo</etym>, <sense id="n18530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwelling by fountains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite igitur Camoenae, Fonticolae puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mus. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mus. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fonticulus: <entryFree id="n18531" type="main" key="fonti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fons</etym>, <sense id="n18531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsiliente dulci fonticulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fontigena: <entryFree id="n18532" type="main" key="fonti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fons-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n18532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born by fountains</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the Muses: <cit><quote lang="la">virginum chorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 908</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o sacra doctarum prudentia fontigenarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, § 574</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fontinalis: <entryFree id="n18533" type="main" key="fonti^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fontĭnālis</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fontān-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fons</etym>, <sense id="n18533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>-. </sense><sense id="n18533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—Deriv. </sense><sense id="n18533.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18533.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: Fontinalis (Fontan-) porta, <hi rend="ital">in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards the</hi> Campus Martius, <hi rend="ital">between the Capitoline and Quirinal hills</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 624, 11</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.; cf. Becker's Antiq. p. 133 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18533.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fontĭnā-lĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Fontān-</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of springs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the</hi> 13<hi rend="ital">th of October</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 22</bibl>; Calend. ap. Inscr. Orell. II. pp. 400, 412; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
for: <entryFree id="n18534" type="main" key="for"><orth extent="full" lang="la">for</orth>, <itype>fātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n18534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. defect.</hi> (the forms in use are fatur, fantur, fabor, fabitur; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> fatus; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> fatus sum or eram; <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> fare, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> fari; and <hi rend="ital">parag.</hi> farier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 242</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> fandi, fando; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> fatu; <hi rend="ital">part. praes.</hi> fans, fantis, fantem; for <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi> faris, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 375</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">fantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. p. 88, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> farer, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Conf. 1, 8</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. bhā-mi, appear; bhās, shine; bhāsh, speak; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa-, fai/nw</foreign>, and <foreign lang="greek">fhmi/</foreign>; Lat. fama, fas, fax, facies, favilla, etc.; cf.: facetus, focus, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 297 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 297 sq.</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 420 sqq.], <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam vetera etiam necessario interim sumuntur, ut fari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; syn.: loquor, dico, perhibeo; inquam. aio). </sense><sense id="n18534.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18534.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: fatur is, qui primum homo significabilem ore mittit vocem. Ab eo ante quam id faciant, pueri dicuntur infantes; <cit><quote lang="la">cum id faciant, jam fari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filius Croesi, cum jam per aetatem fari posset, infans erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim eram infans, qui non farer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescios fari pueros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum fari coepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ad eos is deus, qui omnia genuit, fatur: haec vos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:616" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 616</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venulus dicto parens ita farier infit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor qui tum fatus est, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 30</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fatus validis ingentem viribus hastam contorsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum ingenium fans atque infans tu nondum edidicisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram data copia fandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 520</bibl></cit>: <cb n="FORA" /> fandi doctissima Cymodocea, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mollissima fandi Tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fando tua tela manusque Demoror?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:655" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his fando si nuntius exstitit oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:170" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 170</bibl></cit>.—Fando, for famā, rumore, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearsay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque fando umquam accepit quisquam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>by report</tr>, <tr>by hearsay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fando quidem auditum est, crocodilum aut ibim violatum ab Aegyptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 497</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:484" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 484</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mollia fatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis fatu dignissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl></cit>: famino, dicito, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 10</bibl> (cf. praefor and fruor <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n18534.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18534.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) dementit deliraque fatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sapere et fari possit, quae sentiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: fabitur hoc aliquis, Cic. Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ea fatus eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc talia fatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui talia fanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 65: <cit><quote lang="la">quis talia fando temperet a lacrimis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18534.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog. clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fare age, quid venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 389</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed te qui vivum casus, age fare vicissim Attulerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fare, an patriam spes ulla videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:552" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 552</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18534.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18534.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To utter in prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>: Venus quem fata docet fari, divinum pectus habere, Enn. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Ann. v. 19 ed. Vahl.); cf.: fatis fandis, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 80 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabor enim, quando haec te cura remordet, Longius et volvens fatorum arcana movebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 261</bibl></cit>. Cf. also in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n18534.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sing in verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarpeium nemus et Tarpeiae turpe sepulcrum Fabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 2.!*? In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: Fasti dies sunt, in quibus jus fatur, Suet. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that may be spoken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uttered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi> (opp. to nefandus, wrong): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fanda, nefanda malo permixta furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respersae fando nefandoque sanguine arae, i. e. with blood both of sacrifice and of murder,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at sperate deos memores fandi atque nefandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fanda timemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexpleto non fanda piacula busto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forabilis: <entryFree id="n18535" type="hapax" key="fo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>foro</etym>, <sense id="n18535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be pierced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forabilia ac sectilia quae modice umida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Vulnerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptor ferri nulloque forabilis ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forago: <entryFree id="n18536" type="main" key="fo^ra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing-thread</hi> in a web: forago filum, quo textrices diurnum opus distinguunt: a forando dictum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forago trames diversi coloris, Gloss. Isid.: residens inter pensa et foragines puellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:68" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foramen: <entryFree id="n18537" type="main" key="fo^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aperture</hi> produced by boring, <hi rend="ital">a hole</hi> (rare but class.): neque porta neque ullum foramen erat, qua posset eruptio fieri, <hi rend="ital">outlet</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina parietum et fenestrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: inventa sunt in eo (scuto) foramina CCXXX., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia tenuis simplexque foramine pauco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii (scarabei) focos crebris foraminibus excavant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>: foramina illa, quae patent ad animum a corpore (shortly before, viae quasi quaedam sunt ad oculos, ad aures perforatae; and: quasi fenestrae sint animi), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 47</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18537.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in gen., <hi rend="ital">an opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cave</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 33, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foraminatus: <entryFree id="n18538" type="main" key="fo^ra_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>foramen</etym>, <sense id="n18538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierced through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having holes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foraminosus: <entryFree id="n18539" type="main" key="fo^ra_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrāmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of holes</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foras: <entryFree id="n18540" type="main" key="fo^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏras</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><case>acc.</case> form like alias, alteras, utrasque; while foris is an <case>abl.</case> form; both from an obsol. <case>nom.</case> fora; Sanscr. dvār; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu/ra</foreign>; O. H. Germ. tor; Engl. door</etym>, <sense id="n18540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out through the doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">crepuit foris: Amphitruo exit foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exeundum hercle tibi hinc est foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i foras, mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu foras egressa es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras aedibus me eici?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: homo hercle hinc exclusu'st foras,<pb n="767" /> <cb n="FORD" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum foras extrudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te huc foras seduxi, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese portā foras universi proripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portis se foras erumpunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fer cineres, Amarylli, foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium foras mittere ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (urbs) laetari mihi videtur, quod tantam pestem evomuerit forasque projecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, tuum peccatum esse elatum foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, in qua nihil geratur, quod foras perferendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">efferri hoc foras et ad populi Romani aures pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (animus) eminebit foras, et ea quae extra sunt contemplans, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: justitia foras spectat et projecta tota est atque eminet, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 373, 25</bibl> (Rep. 3, 7 ed. Mos.): (scripta) foras dare, <hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, = edere, proferre, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locitare agellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to strangers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, vade foras, aut moribus utere nostris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>leave the house</tr>, <tr>separale from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18540.1" n="(b)" level="5"> Connected with a <hi rend="ital">noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite hac simul heri damnigeruli, foras gerones, Bonorum hamaxagogae,</quote> <trans><tr>carriers out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18540.2" n="(g)" level="5"> Post-class. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or like a preposition with the <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ea namque tabes, si foras corporis prospiravit, <hi rend="ital">out of the body</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)kto\s tou= sw/matos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra urbem et foras portam,</quote> <trans><tr>outside of</tr>, <tr>without</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 27, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">foras exteriorem partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque foras civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18540.3" n="2" level="3"> For foris, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras cenare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forasticus: <entryFree id="n18541" type="main" key="fo^rasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>foras</etym>, <sense id="n18541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Septen. Col. 167</bibl></cit> M.</sense></entryFree>
foratus: <entryFree id="n18542" type="main" key="fo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>foro</etym>, <sense id="n18542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boring</hi> (postclass., and only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">a quo foratu frontem nominatam Varro existimavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem foratu effeminatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forbeam: <entryFree id="n18543" type="gloss" key="forbeam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forbeam</orth> <itype>antiqui omne genus cibi appellabant</itype>, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">forbh/n</foreign> vocant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
forceps: <entryFree id="n18544" type="main" key="forceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype> (<sense id="n18544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> forcipium, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 277</bibl>) [root in Sanscr. ghar-mas, glow, warmth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qer-, qe/rmh, qe/ros</foreign>; Lat. for-mus, for-nus, fornax and cap-io], <hi rend="ital">a pair of tongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pincers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forceps</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forfex, volsella): forcipem invenit Cinyra Agriopae filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 195</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n18544.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopes versant tenaci forcipe ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 175</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">firetongs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 404</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 277</bibl>: uncis forcipibus dentes evelleret, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">pincers</hi> for drawing teeth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and for other surgical purposes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressa forcipe lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu guttura forcipe pressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 78</bibl></cit>: ferrei, <hi rend="ital">iron tongs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hooks attached to a tackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by firmly grasping a mass of stone or marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise it aloft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl> (al. forfices).—</sense><sense id="n18544.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of battlearray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with diverging wings</hi>, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. serra, p. 344 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 18</bibl> (al. forfex).</sense></entryFree>
forctis: <entryFree id="n18545" type="gloss" key="forctis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forctis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. fortis <sense id="n18545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
forculus: <entryFree id="n18546" type="main" key="Forcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Forcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from Foriculus, from 1. foris</etym>, <sense id="n18546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity who presides over the doors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 15</bibl>; Coron. Mil. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
forda: <entryFree id="n18547" type="main" key="forda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fordus.</entryFree>
fordicidia: <entryFree id="n18548" type="gloss" key="fordi^ci_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fordĭcīdĭa</orth> (archaic form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĭ-cīdia</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll., <sense id="n18548.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>forda + caedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the sacrifice of a cow that is with calf</hi>, which was performed on the 16th of April, in honor of Tellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> and 102 Müll., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll. article</ref></xr>.</sense></entryFree>
fordus: <entryFree id="n18549" type="main" key="fordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fordus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic form <orth extent="full" lang="la">hordus</orth>, <sense id="n18549.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fordicidia a fordis bubus: bos forda quae fert in ventre, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: fordicidiis boves fordae id est gravidae immolabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia post Veneris cum lux surrexerit Idus. Pontifices, forda sacra litate bove. Forda ferens bos est fecundaque, dicta ferendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:630 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 630 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">forda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cow that is with calf</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:631" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 631</bibl>.—Archaic form: <cb n="FORI" /> horda praegnans, unde dies, quo gravidae hostiae immolabantur, hordicidia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
